El comité “Mujeres Trabajando Juntas”tiene  mas de 2 años de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya , la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero incluyen entre sus integrantes a 2 señoras que emprenderán actividades.
 Incluyen entre las actividades realizadas la venta de frutas y verduras , venta de comestibles artesanales como empanadas de carne ,empanadas de pollo ,empanadas de jamón y queso ,venta de mercaderías varias como :fideo ,azúcar , harina ,aceite, jabón, entre otros artículos ,venta de ropas , venta de remedios etc. Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales  para  su desarrollo y formación. 
Unos de los casos es el de Doña Francisca vendedora de yuyos quien desde muy temprana se traslada en el mercado para comprar su mercadería y recorre para venderla en las despensas y casas particulares de diferentes Barrios de la ciudad de Asunción.
Ella muy querida por sus clientes y los mismos siempre compran sus productos nos comentó Doña Francisca y a la ves agradece al a Fundación Paraguaya por apoyarle en su trabajo que sostiene a su familia con 10 integrantes.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Trabajando Juntas" (Women Working Together) village bank has been in existence for two years and works with the Fundación Paraguaya. Most of its members are already working productively, but two of its members are women who have yet to begin activities. The activities they carry out include the sale of fruits and vegetables, sale of home-made foods such as meat, chicken and ham empanadas (savory pastries); the sale of various goods like noodles, sugar, flour, oil, and ham; and articles such as clothing, home remedies and others. They dream of a better future for their children, and for this reason work twice as hard to provide them with the things they need for their development and education.

One example is that of Doña Francisca, a seller of medicinal herbs who goes to the market early in the morning to buy her merchandise and hurries back to sell it among the shops and households in different neighborhoods in the city of Asunción. She is much loved by her clients, and the same ones always buy her products, says Doña Francisca, who in turn thanks the Fundación Paraguaya for supporting her in her work which maintains her family of ten.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale such as: Christmas items, Herbal Remedies, and Food Ingredients.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
ANTONIETA Q. B., ES TESORERA DEL GRUPO "SAN FRANCISCO" INTEGRADO POR 10 PERSONAS QUE RESIDEN EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS. ANTONIETA TIENE 48 AÑOS D. EDAD,ESTÁ CASADA Y TIENE TRES HIJOS, ELLA SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR PRENDAS D. VESTIR SOBRE PEDIDO.
DEBIDO A QUE SU ESPOSO QUEDÓ SIN TRABAJO, ELLA TUVO QUE INGENIARSELA PARA APOYAR A SU ESPOSO, E INCIÓ CON UNA ACTIVIDAD QUE LE IVA A PERMITIR DESARROLLAR SUS HABILIDADES EN LA COSTURA Y CONFECCIÓN D. PRENDAS D. VESTIR.
CON SU TRABAJO HA LOGRADO APOYAR ECONÓMICAMENTE A SUS HIJOS PARA QUE OBTENGAN SU PROFESIÓN, ARREGLAR SU CASA E INSTALAR UNA BODEGA EN SU DOMICILIO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA COMPRAR SUS MATERIALES Y TELAS PARA CONFECCIONAR ROPA PARA LA TEMPORADA D. VERANO.
texts.en:
Antonieta Q. B. is the treasurer of group San Francisco maD. up of 10 people who live in the district of Comas. Antonieta is 48 years old, married and has three kids. She makes clothes to order. Owing to the fact that her husband was without work, she had to think up an activity to support her husband. She started with an activity that allowed her to develop abilities in sewing and clothes to order.

With her job, she has achieved economic support of her children so they can become professionals. Also it has helped to fix the house and to install a bar in their home. This loan is being requested to be used for buying materials and fabrics to make clothes for the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in materials for making clothes

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” desde hace 2 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores.
Gladys nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital y comprar dos ovejas y chanchos.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar un toro para luego engordarlo y finalmente venderlo.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Puno y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias para todas las actividades.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the community bank "Gregoria Apaza," in the llave district, in the El Collao province, in the department of Puno. She has been a member for 2 years. She is 35 years old, and is married with two children. She completed her secondary studies and now works buying and selling young animals.

Gladys tells us that with her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for 300 Soles, she was able to increase her capital and purchase two sheep and pigs. She now seeks a loan for 1000 Soles, with which she will be able to buy a bull to raise and eventually sell.

Her dream for the future is to have her own home in Puno and that her children can become working professionals. What she likes most about her organization is the punctuality of the members for all the activities.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La señora Wilma es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desde hace 2 años atrás, del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra de ganado.
Wilma nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar animales menores.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar alimento balanceado  y forraje para el ganado.
Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su situación económica y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Wilma has been a partner of the communal bank "Lupakas" for two years now. She is from the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, and department of Puno. She is 34 years old, a single mother, and has two children. She completed her secondary education and makes a living by purchasing livestock. Wilma tells us that with the first loan requested from Movimiento Manuela Ramos, of 300.00 nuevos soles, she was able to buy small animals. Now, she is requesting a credit of 1,500.00 nuevos soles, with which she will be able to purchase balanced food and forage for her livestock. Her dream for the future is to improve her economic situation and for her children to become professionals. The things she likes most about her communal bank are the savings and the meetings with her partners.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase balanced food for her livestock

loans.name: Roger Patricio

texts.es:
El señor Roger es socio del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 4 meses atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 33 años de edad, es viudo y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a dar servicios de mototaxi.
Roger nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar su moto.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar los repuestos de su moto.
Su sueño para el futuro es salir adelante con sus hijas.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es que esta bien organizado.
texts.en:
Mr. Roger has been a member of the Gran Poder (Great Power) Community Bank for 4 months, in the District of Llave, Province of Collao, Department of Puno. He is 33 years old, a widower, and has two children. He completed secondary school and works providing motorcycle taxi services. Roger tells us that with the first loan of 1,000 PEN he requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement he was able to buy his motorcycle. Now he is requesting a credit of 500 PEN with which he will be able to buy parts for his motorcycle. His dream for the future is to move ahead with his daughters. What he likes most about his Community Bank is that is is well organized.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Raquel es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 5 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió primaria completa y tiene su fotocopiadora.
Raquel nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar una fotocopiadora.
Su sueño para el futuro es salir adelante y así poder vivir feliz y tranquila.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Raquel has been a partner of the communal bank "Gran Poder" for five years now. She is from the district of Llave, province of El Collao, and department of Puno. She is 33 years old, married, and has two children. Raquel tells us that with the first loan she solicited from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, of 300.00 nuevos soles, she was able to increase her capital. Currently, she is requesting a credit of 3,000.00 nuevos soles, with which she will be able to purchase a photocopier. Her dream for the future is to get ahead and thereby live happily and peacefully. The things that she likes most about her communal bank are the savings and the meetings with her partners.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan” desde hace 3 año atrás del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Estudiò secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales y gaseosas.
Maria nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital y comprar chuño, habas, cebada y gaseosas.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar màs mercadería como chuño ,habas, cebada, y gaseosas.
Su sueño para el futuro es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad de las reuniones.
texts.en:
Maria has been a member of the community bank "San Juan," in the Yunguyo district and province and department of Puno, for 3 years. She is 37 years old, lives in common law marriage, and has two children. She completed her secondary education and now buys and sells cereals and soft drinks.

Maria tells us that with her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for 500 Soles, she was able to increase her capital and buy chuño (dried potatoes), beans, barley, and soft drinks. She now seeks a loan of 1500 Soles with which she will be able to buy more merchandise like chuño, beans, barley, and soft drinks.

Her dream for the future is that her children can become working professionals. Her favorite things about her community bank are the savings and the punctuality of the members.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chuño (dried potatoes), beans, barley, and soft drinks

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. HAYDEE TEOFILA G. S., TIENE 42 AÑOS,TIENE 5 HIJOS,ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO "LAS MARGARITAS" FORMADO POR 11 SOCIOS QUE RESIDEN EN EL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO.
LA SRA. HAYDEE, SE DEDICA A TRABAJAR EN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES, COMO VENTA D. COSMÉTICOS,ROPA, SIENDO SU PRINCIPAL ACTIVIDAD EL SERVICIO D. BORDADOS EN LENTEJUELAS.
HACE TRES AÑOS ELLA EMPEZÓ A TRABAJAR PARA UN TALLER D. CONFECCIONES,DOND. ELLA ERA LA ENCARGADA D. HACER LOS BORDADOS, AHORA ELLA ES EL NEXO PARA QUE OTRAS PERSONAS PUEDAN OBTENER UN INGRESO ECONÓMICO DESD. SUS DOMICILIOS. LA SRA. HAYDEE SE ENCARGA D. REPARTIR LA MERCADERÍA A PERSONAS QUE SE DEDICAN A ÉSTE BORDADO CON LENTEJUELAS, Y SE ENCARGA D. ENSEÑARLE LA LABOR.
CON SU TRABAJO, ELLA PUED. CUBRIR LOS GASTOS D. MANTENCIÓN D. SUS HIJOS
LE GUSTARÍA MAS ADELANTE APERTURAR UN BAZAR D. VENTA D. ROPA.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO DESTINARÁ A LA COMPRA D. CELULARES Y ACCESORIOS PARA LA VENTA.
texts.en:
Mrs. Haydee Teofila G. S. is 42 years old and has 5 kids. She is a member of the "Las Margaritas" (Daisies) Group formed by 11 members that live in the district of Carabayllo. Mrs. Haydee does a few different jobs such as the sale of cosmetics and clothes but her main job is providing the service of sewing on sequins. Three years ago, she started working for a clothing manufacturer where she was in charge of adding sequins. Now, she is the hub of a network that allows other people to earn an income working from home. Mrs. Haydee is in charge of distributing the merchandise to the people who will do the sewing on of the sequins and she teaches them how to do it. With her work, she can cover the expenses of raising her children. She would someday like to open a market for clothing sales. With the loan, she will buy cellphones and accessories for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cellphones

loans.name: Kuña Kyre´y Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Kyre´y se encuentra actualmente en su 2º ciclo cuenta con 18 integrantes.
Las integrantes se dedican a actividades varias entre las que se destaca la venta de comestibles, bebidas, despensa, peluquería, además de venta de ropas ,   entre otras cosas el destino de los fondos va para la compra de materiales como telas, ropas, hilos, carne, aceite, verduras, kiosko  entre otras cosas.
El comité presenta buena relación interna y respeto entre sus integrantes. Destacamos que es un comité nuevo pero no obstante mediante el esfuerzo de sus integrantes están consiguiendo buenos resultados.
Entre sus metas inmediatas resaltan la necesidad de que sus hijos se formen academicamente y puedan optar por un buen empleo,es por eso que redoblan esfuerzos para poder darles los materiales que puedan posibilitar lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
The Kuña Kyre'y community bank is currently in its second round of loans and has 18 members. Its members conduct various activities the most important of which include the sale of prepared food, drinks, a grocery and a hair salon, as well as clothes. Among other things, the loans go to purchase materials such as fabric, clothing, thread, meat, oil and vegetables.

The group members show the good relations and respect they have for each other. We point out that this is a new group, but they are nevertheless achieving good results through the efforts of its members.

The need for their children to get an education and be able to choose a good job stands out among the group's most important objectives. This is why they are renewing their efforts to give them the things they need that will enable them to meet their goals.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The women will put the loan to use purchasing ingredientes such as oil, vegetables, rice and flour for those with retail shops; as well as fruit, soft drinks, sugar, plastic containers and spoons for those who sell fruit salads; and clothes and seasonal items such as caps, gloves, underwear, jeans and shirts for quick sale during the season.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 10 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo. Estudió primaria completa. Se dedica a la elaboración de panes y paralelamente a la compra y venta de carne.
Flora nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar carne.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar harina, azúcar, manteca y leña para la elaboración del pan.
Su sueño para el futuro es vivir feliz sin ningún problema.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad de las socias en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Flora has been a member of the Communal Bank "Gran Poder" for 10 years in the Llave district, El Collao province, in the state of Puno. She is 43 years old, married, and has one child. She completed primary school. She makes bread and also buys and sells meat. Flora tells us that with her first loan, taken out through the Manuela Ramos Movement for 300.00 soles, she was able to purchase meat. She is requesting a loan of 1,500.00 soles to purchase flour, sugar, butter and firewood to make bread. He dream for the future is to live happily without any problems. What she likes best about the Communal Bank are the savings and the punctuality of the members at meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, firewood, butter, flour

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Dominga es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desD. hace 3 años atrás, del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 64 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta D. sogas.
Dominga nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar lana, hilos y nylon para elaborar las sogas.
Su sueño para el futuro es vivir tranquila en compañía D. sus nietos y seguir trabajando.
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Dominga has been a member of "Lupakas" communal bank for three years, in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, state of Puno. She is 64 years old, widowed, and has 5 children. She completed her secondary education and buys and sells ropes. Dominga tells us that the first loan she took out from the Manual Ramos Movement was for 300 soles to increase her capital. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles which she will use to purchase wool, thread, and nylon to make rope. Her dream for the future is to live peacefully with her grandchildren and continue working. What she likes best about her communal bank are the savings and the member meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool, thread, nylon

loans.name: Jesus Antonia

texts.es:
La señora  JESÚS ANTONIA M. R. tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de EL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA. La socia presenta estudios hasta 3ero de secundaria, refiere que dejò los estudios por falta de recursos económicos. Es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. 
Jesús se dedica a la atenciòn de su bodega que tiene en su casa. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò productos alimenticios como: arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas, aceite, fideos, menestras, etc. para surtir su tienda.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 1,000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà productos alimenticios para su bodega como: arroz, golosinas, leche, gaseosas, cerveza,  fideos, menestras, etc. 
Ella sueña con ir ampliando su tienda y aumentaar sus ventas y ganancias, ya que necesita generar mayores ingresos para la familia y en especial para educar a sus 5 hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. JESÚS ANTONIA M. R. is 35 years old and lives in the district of El Porvenir in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad in Peru. She belongs to the community bank Esperanza del Mañana. This bank member completed her third year of high school and tells us that she had to quit her studies because of a lack of money. She is married and has five children who depend on her financially. Jesús makes her living thanks to the store she has set up in her home. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, milk, candy, oil, noodles, soups and so on in order to stock her store. She now needs a loan of 1000 soles which she will use to buy foodstuffs for her store such as rice, candy, milk, pop, beer, noodles, soups etc. She dreams of expanding her store and increasing her sales and profits as she now needs to make more income to support her family and especially to educate her five children.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, candy, milk, pop, beer, noodles, soups, etc.

loans.name: Armida

texts.es:
La señora Armida es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 10 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Estudió primaria incompleta y se dedica a la compra y venta de animales; a su vez cuenta con un horno donde hace panes.
Armida nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar harina, azúcar, manteca, leña, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave y comprarse un carro.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad de las socias en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Mrs. Armida has been a member of the communal bank, “Gran Poder” (Great Power) for the past 10 years in the Ilave District, El Collao province, in the Puno Department. She is 34, married, and has 4 children. She didn’t finish primary school. She works buying and selling animals, and uses her oven to bake bread. Armida tells us that with the first loan she received from the Manuela Ramos Movement of 300 new sols, she increased her capital. She is asking for a loan of 700 new sols so that she can buy flour, sugar, lshortening, firewood, etc. Her dream for the future is to have her own home in Ilave and to buy a car. What she likes best about the communal bank is the savings and punctuality of the members at the meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, shortening, firewood

loans.name: Silvia Soledad

texts.es:
La señora SILVIA SOLEDAD S. D. A. tiene 49 años, vive en el distrito D. EL PORVENIR, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA. 
La socia presenta estudios secundarios completos, es casada y tiene 3 hijos todos mayores e independientes. Ella se dedica a realizar manualidades, tejidos, bordados D. manteles, chompas, etc.
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprò material para realizar las manualidades D. los pedidos que tenìa por entregar como: hilos, lanas, cintas, blondas, etc.
En la actualidad solicitarà un crédito D. 1500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà materiales como: telas, hilos, lanas, blondas, mostacillas, etc. para realizar los pedidos que tiene pendiente por època naviD.ña. 
Silvia sueña con alquilar un puesto en el mercado en donD. exhibir y vender sus manualidades con mayor frecuencia para generar así mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia is 49 years old and lives in the El Provenir district, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad in Peru. She belongs to the “Hope for Tomorrow” Community Bank. This member has completed her secondary studies, is married and has three children that are grown and independent. She does handwork such as handkerchiefs, embroidered borders on tablecloths, knitted sweaters, etc. With her first loan of 300 new soles she bought supplies to do handwork that has already been ordered. The supplies are fabric, thread, wool, lace, beads, etc. that she will use to make the orders for the Christmas season. Silvia’s dream is to rent a booth in the market where she can display and sell her handiwork. She would have greater exposure so she could generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy thread, lace, ribbon, beads, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.en:
For the last 16 years, Esperanza del Socorro has worked selling electric household appliances, plastic bags, and sodas in the City of Leon. She is requesting a loan to buy capital for her store. She wants to buy appliances including TVs and refrigerators to sell. Esperanza works everyday from 4:00am to 6:00pm. Twice a week (or when clients demand is up more frequently) she buys goods for her store. Her store is located in the La Terminal Market.

Esperanza is single. She is responsible for taking care of one of her grandchildren. Before selling appliances, she sold aprons “ambulante”, which means while walking around the street with her goods. She has been working with CEPRODEL for 5 years. This is her 27th loan. The loans have helped her expand and improve the quality of her business, she said.

loans.use: To buy household appliances like TVs and refrigerators to sell

loans.name: Herminia Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Herminia es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desde hace 4 años atrás, del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y soga.
Herminia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con los que pudo comprar materia prima para la elaboración de soga.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar un toro.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Puno y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad que hay con las socias.
texts.en:
Mrs.Herminia has been a member of the “Lupakas” Community Bank for the past four years. She is from the Pilcuyo district, in the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 35 years old, has a domestic partner and has two children. She has completed her secondary studies. She buys and sells cattle and rope. Herminia told us that with her first loan that she received from the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for 300 new soles, she was able to buy raw material, which she used to make rope. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 new soles, which she will use to buy a bull. Her dreams for the future are to have a house in Puno and to have children that have professional careers. What she likes the most about the communal bank are their savings and the punctuality of the members.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy a bull.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
La señora Marta es socia del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador de Conchaca” desde hace 01 año atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de sogas.
Marta nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar materiales para la fabricación de sogas.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,600.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar hilos, lana, nylon.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda en Ilave y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marta has been a member of the “Child of San Salvador of Conchaca” Community Bank for the past year. She is from the Llave District, in the El Collao Province, in the department of Puno. She is 25 years old, is married and has two children. She has finished her secondary studies. She buys and sells rope. Marta told us that with the first loan that she requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for 500 new soles, she was able to buy materials to make rope. She is asking for a loan of 1,600.00 new soles that she will use to buy thread, wool and nylon. Her dreams for the future are to have a store in Llave and to have children that have professional careers. What she likes the most about the community bank are their savings and the meetings with their members.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy thread, wool and nylon.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La señora Florencia  es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desD. hace 2 años atrás, del distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 53 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Florencia no estudió. Ella tiene su tienda D. ferreterìa.
Florencia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar cemento, fierro, alambrón, alambre, clavos, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia e instalar ahí su tienda D. abarrotes.
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad D. las socias en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Florencia has been a member of the "Gran Poder" communal bank for two years, located in the Ilave district, El Collao province, state of Puno. She is 53 years old, married, and has 4 children. Florencia did not attend school. She has a hardware store. She tells us that her first loan with the Manuela Ramos Movement was for 50i0 soles to increase her capital. She is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles which she will use to purchase cement, iron, rolled wire, wire, nails, etc. Her dream for the future is to have her own home where she would set up a general store. What she likes best about her communal bank are the savings and the punctuality of the members in meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement, rolled wire, wire, nails

loans.name: Alejandro Secundino

texts.es: El Señor Alejandro G. tiene 48 años de edad, es Casado y con oficios  Comerciante,  cuenta con  un pequeño negocio habita junto  a su esposa, y su Esposa se dedican al mismo oficio,  lleva 12 años  de Vender,   su residencia se encuentra en el Paraje Choatzam, del Cantón Juchanep del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en las que se encuentran no son suficientes para que ellos puedan aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandro G. is 48 and married. He has a small business. He lives with his wife, and she is in the same business. He has been selling for 12 years. His house is in Paraje Choatzam in the Juchanep canton, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Currently his customer demand has grown, but the economic condition he finds himself in is not sufficient to augment his capital. That is the reason he has come to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. His intention is to buy more merchandise. That way he will be able to increase his sales. He is also hoping to get his family ahead so that they can have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El señor Angel C. P. tiene 46 años y vive en la zona de Esquilan Chico en la zona Sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Angel aun no se caso y vive en casa de su madre. Angel trabajaba como constructor albañil toda su vida pero como su madre y padre son personas de mucha edad, el decidió dejar ese trabajo y dedicarse a la producción de leche cruda junto a sus padres. En esta casa es donde tiene 8 vacas lecheras que fueron la herencia que le dio su mama para que él se haga cargo.

Angel aun quisiera formar una familia, tener hijos y en un futuro nietos, pero él nos dice que lo primero es su mama y su papa y que después habar tiempo para todo lo demás. El crédito será destinado a la compra de otra vaca lechera, para de este modo poder incrementar su producción lechera y sus ingresos.

Angel nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad que pueda a sus padres para que el día que mueran, lo hagan felices. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que saque quisiera utilizarlo para poder mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Angel C. P. is 46. He lives in the Esquilan Chico area south of the city of Cochababa. Angel has not yet married, and he lives in his mother’s house. Angel worked all of his life in construction as a bricklayer. Because his parents are elderly, he decided to leave this work and work with his parents in the production of raw milk. He has eight dairy cows at his house. His mother gave them to him so that he would manage them. Angel would still like to have a family, have children, and have grandchildren in the future. But, he says, his mother and father come first. Later, there will be time for the rest. The loan is to buy another dairy cow. That way he will be able to increase dairy production and his earnings. Angel tells us that his greatest dream is to be able to give his parents all of the comforts he can so that they will die happy. He also tells us that the next loan he takes he would like to use to be able to improve the condition of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
La señora Casilda es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Juan”, en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Estudió secundaria incompleta y se dedica a la venta de repuestos de artefactos.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años atrás y su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para comprar transistores y bujías.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.2500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà repuestos de carro.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener su casa propia en la ciudad de Yunguyo y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que màs le gusta de su organización es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Casilda is a member of the San Juan communal bank in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the state of Puno. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She did not complete her secondary education. She sells spare parts. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six years and her first loan was for 300 soles which she used to purchase transistors and spark plugs. She is requesting a loan for 2,500 soles which she will used to buy spare parts for cars. Her hope for the future is to have her own home in the city of Yunguyo and that her children become professionals. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spark plugs and pistons

loans.name: Irma Marleni

texts.es:
La señora IRMA MARLENI M. SÁNCHEZ tiene 44 años, vive en el distrito de EL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA. 
La socia presenta estudios secundarios completos, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Irma se dedica a la venta de plantillas, cueros, pegamentos para calzado.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò cuero, plantillas al por mayor, pegamento, etc.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1,500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà plantillas al por mayor, cuero, pegamentos, hilos, etc.
Irma sueña con ampliar su negocio e invertir en el negocio de cabinas de Internet para lo cual està ahorrando.
texts.en:
Irma Marleni M. S. is 44 years old. She lives in the district of El Porvenir, in the Trujillo province, state of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the Esperanza del Mañana communal bank. She completed her secondary education. She lives with her partner and has 4 children whom she supports. She sells soles, leather and glue for shoes. With her first loan for 300 soles she purchased leather, shoe soles wholesale, glue, etc. She currently needs a loan for 1,500 soles which she will use to purchase shoe soles wholesale, leather, glue, thread, etc. Irma dreams of growing her business and investing in an Internet cafe business, something for which she is saving.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase shoe soles wholesale, leather, thread, glue, etc.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La señora Olga es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Juan”, en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 45 años de edad, es vuida y tiene 5 hijos. Estudió secundaria incompleta y se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años atrás y su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para aumentar su mercadería.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà ropa, para de esa manera aumentar su capital.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener su casa en Yunguyo y tener su propio capital.
Lo que màs le gusta de su organización es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the "San Juan" community bank in the district and province of Yunguyo, department of Puno. She is 45 years old, a widow, and has 5 children. She did not complete secondary school, and she buys and sells clothing. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the last 8 years, and her first loan of 300 nuevos soles allowed her to increase her merchandise. She is now asking for a loan of 500 nuevos soles so she can buy clothing and as such increase her capital. Her future wish is to have her home in Yunguyo and to have her own money. What she likes the best about her organization are the savings and the meetings for the members.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Angela Elena

texts.es: La Señora Angela V. tiene 23 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Comerciante,  “Venta de delantales Típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un pequeño Negocio, habita junto  a su esposo  e hija, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 5 años de elaborar  Cortes Típicos en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Choqui, de la Aldea Chipuac  del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar  mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Angela V. is 23 and married. She is a businesswoman. She sells typical aprons for women. She has a small business. She lives with her husband and daughter. She and her husband work in the same business, and they have two employees. She has been making typical clothes for five years. She does this at her house in the Caserío Choqui, Chipuac village, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Currently her customer demand has grown. However, the economic situation she finds herself in does not allow her to increase her capital. That is the reason she has come to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. She wants to buy more merchandise in order to be able to increase her sales. She is also hoping to get her family ahead and that they will have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena sells used clothing in the City of Leon. Her clothing stand is an open-air stall. She started the business 17 years ago using her own savings and it has been located in the same place ever since. She is requesting a loan to invest in working capital for her business. She would like to buy a bale of used clothing to resell in her store. Maria works from 6am to 5pm everyday. She travels to Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, twice a week to purchase merchandise for her store.

Maria is single with two children. Both of her children are school aged. She has been working with CEPRODEL for 4 years and this is her 30th loan. Her past loans have helped her gradually expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desde hace 3 años atrás(reingresante), del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y sogas.
Miriam nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar materiales para la fabricación de sogas.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar una vaca.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su propio capital y de esa manera trabajar mejor.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Olga has been a member of the "Lupakas" community bank for the last three years (when she re-enrolled) in the district of Pilcuyo, province El Collao, department of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children. She did not complete secondary school, and she buys and sells livestock and ropes. Miriam says her with first loan through the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 500 nuevos soles she was able to buy materials for the rope production. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles with which to buy a cow. Her future wish is to have her own capital and in that way be able to work better. What she likes the best about her organization are the savings and the meetings for the members.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Nury

texts.es:
La señora Nury es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 10 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo. Estudió primaria incompleta y se dedica a la compra y venta de coca y cigarro.
Nury nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar coca y cigarro.
Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la reunión con las socias.
texts.en:
Nury has been a member of the "Gran Poder" community bank for the last 10 years in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 49 years old, a single mother, and has 1 son. She did not complete primary school, and she buys and sells coca and cigars. Nury says her with first loan through the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 300 nuevos soles she was able to increase her capital. She is now requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles with which she will buy more coca and cigars. Her future wish is to improve her business. What she likes the best about her organization are the savings and the meetings for the members.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coca and cigars

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
La señora Marta es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 10 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo. Estudió primaria completa y tiene una tienda de abarrotes.
Marta nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su mercadería.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, con el que podrá comprar casacas para vender en año nuevo.
Su sueño para el futuro es progresar con su negocio y juntar dinero para poder vivir bien y viajar con su hijo.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y los incentivos.
texts.en:
Marta has been a member of the "Gran Poder" community bank in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno for the last 10 years. She is 35 years old, lives with her partner, and has 1 son. She did not complete primary school, and she has a grocery store. Marta says that her with first loan through the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 300 nuevos soles she was able to increase her merchandise. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles with which she can buy casacas (a type of long coat) to sell in the coming year. Her future wish is to advance with her business and to save money to be able to live well with her son. What she likes the best about her community bank are the savings and the incentives.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coats

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 4 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió primaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes.
Nancy nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar harina, azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su tienda.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Nancy has been a member of the "Gran Poder" community bank in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno for the last 4 years. She is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children. She finished primary school, and she buys and sells groceries. Nancy says that her with first loan through the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 500 nuevos soles she was able to increase her capital. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles with which she can buy flour, sugar, rice, pasta, etc. Her future wish is to have her own store. What she likes the best about her community bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, sugar, rice, and pasta

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica al engorde de animales.
Gloria nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital y comprar ovejas.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar una vaca.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Ilave y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Gloria has been a member of the Lupakas communal bank for three years, located in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno state. She is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. She completed secondary school. She fattens animals for a living. With her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement for 300 soles she was able to increase her capital and purchase sheep. She is requesting a loan for 3,000 soles which she will used to purchase a cow. Her dream for the future is to have a house in Ilave and for her children to be professionals. What she likes best about her communal bank are the savings and the member meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Diana Yanet

texts.es:
La señora Diana es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desde hace 3 meses atrás(reingresante), del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió superior completo y se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
Diana nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar ovejas y chanchos.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa y vivir con todas las comodidades.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Diana rejoined the "Gran Poder" community bank in the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, department of Puno as a member 3 months ago. She is 25 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children. She finished high school, and she buys and sells livestock. Diana says that her with first loan through the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 500 nuevos soles she was able to increase her capital. She is now requesting a loan of 500 nuevos soles with which she can buy sheep and hogs. Her future wish is to have her own home and to live with all the amenities. What she likes the best about her community bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and hogs

loans.name: Tani Elena

texts.en:
Tani Elena V., aged 67, has been running a grocery store in the Central Market in the City of Leon for 16 years. She originally started the business with C$4000 (US$200) that her husband gave her. Though it has always been in the same spot, it has grown a lot. She is requesting this loan to buy products for her store. She would like to buy a little bit of all of her most popular grocery products.

Everyday Tani’s store is open from 9am – 5pm. Her customers all come to her stall in the market to make their purchases. Her stall is a very secure structure made of concrete and wrought iron. Tani has been working with CEPRODEL for five years. In that time she has had 55 loans. The loans have helped her expand her business little by little and also have improved her quality of life.

loans.use: To stock her store with its most popular grocery products

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La señora Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” desde hace 2 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Estudió superior completo y se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores.
Delfina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital y comprar ovejas y chanchos.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar un toro.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Delfina became a member of the “Gregoria Apaza” community bank in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno 2 years ago. She is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children. She completed high school, and she works in the buying and selling of livestock. Delfina says that with her first loan through the Movimiento Manuela Ramos of 300 nuevos soles she was able to increase her capital and buy sheep and pigs. She is now requesting a loan of 800 with which she can buy a bull. Her future dream is to have her own home in Ilave and that her children become professionals. The things she likes best about her community bank are the savings and the meetings for the members.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchse of a bull

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La señora Wilma es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan” desde hace 1 año atrás del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Estudiò secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales.
Wilma nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital y así comprar chuño, habas, cebada.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1800.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar dos vacas lecheras para expandir su negocio.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad de las reuniones.
texts.en:
Señora Wilma has been a member of the San Juan village bank for the last year. It is located inn the far edge of the district and province of Yunguyo and the department of Puno. She is 26 years old and is married with four children. She finished highschool and began buying and selling grains. Her first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for S/. 500.00 nuevos soles so she could increase her capital and buy chuño (dehydrated potatoes), lima beans and barley. She has requested a loan for S/. 1800.00 nuevos soles with which she will buy two cows and expand her business. She dreams about having her own home and for her children to be professionals in the future. Her favorite thing about her village bank is the savings account and how punctual their meetings are.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Geovana

texts.es:
La señorita Geovana es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 2 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Tiene estudios superiores y cuenta con una tienda de fotocopiado.
Geovana nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar papel y toner para de esa manera hacer crecer su negocio.
Su sueño para el futuro es ser empresaria.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Geovana has been a member of the “Great Power” cooperative bank for 2 years, located in the Ilave district of Collao, Puno. She is 23 years old, single, and doesn’t have any children. She completed her secondary education, and has a photocopy store. Geovana tells us that her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles from the Manuela Ramos Movement augmented her working capital. She is requesting a loan of 2,000.00 soles to buy paper and toner, in order to help her business grow. Her future dream is to be a businesswoman. The things she enjoys most about being part of a cooperative bank are the punctuality and the member meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase paper and toner.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La señora Fortunata es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 56 años de edad, no cuenta con estudios, es casada y tiene 6 hijos. 
La señora Fortunata se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año. Su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de ganado.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.2300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà ganado como: toro, ovejas, etc.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener su propio capital y así no tener que pedir prestado.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los préstamos y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Fortunata is a member of the “Manuelas of Today II” cooperative bank, located in the Ilave district of Collao, Puno. She is 56 years old, has no formal education, and is married and has 6 children. Fortunata dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of livestock, and has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 1 year. Her first loan was for 500.00 Peruvian soles, which she used to buy livestock. She is requesting a loan of 2,300.00 soles to buy animals such as: a bull, sheep, etc. Her dream for the future is to have her own capital, and not have to request loans. The things she enjoys most about being part of a cooperative bank are the access to credit and the member meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull and sheep.

loans.name: Fuata

texts.en:
Fuata is 32 and single with no children.  She is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.    Fuata needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 35 talas or US $15 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Fuata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fuata's 1st loan with SPBD. 

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

Overall Social Metric Score:               1 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3

 About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. 

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Edelmira Leonor

texts.es:
La señora EDELMIRA LEONOR G. V. tiene 56 años, vive en el distrito de MOCHE , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN DE FATIMA . La socia presenta estudios  secundarios completos, es casada y tiene 1 mayor e independiente. 
La socia se dedica a la preparación y venta de menú en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò arroz, menestras, fideos, azúcar, pollo, aceite, papas, etc.  para la elaboraciòn de la comida que vende.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1,500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà platos, mesas y sillas para su local. Ella sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
EDELMIRA LEONOR G. V. is 56 years old and lives in the MOCHE district of the Trujillo province, located in La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the VIRGEN DE FATIMA cooperative bank. This member completed her secondary studies, is married, and has one grown child that lives independently. She dedicates herself to food preparation and sales in her home. She used her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles to buy rice, vegetables, noodles, sugar, chicken, cooking oil, potatoes, etc., to make the foods she sells. Currently, she needs a loan of 1,500.00 soles with which she will buy plates, tables, and chairs for her store. She dreams of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tables, chairs and plates.

loans.name: Regina Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Regina es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 2 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió primaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales de la región.
Regina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar chuño, habas, tunta, papa, cañihua, quinua, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave y mejorar su negocio.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la puntualidad de las socias en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Regina has been a member of the “Great Power” cooperative bank for 2 years, located in the Ilave district of the El Collao province, in Puno. She is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children. She completed her primary school studies, and dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of regional grains. Regina tells us that, with her first loan of 500.00 Peruvian soles from the Manuela Ramos Movement, she was able to augment her working capital. She is requesting a loan of 1,000.00 soles with which she will be able to buy potato flour, beans, potatoes, cañihua (an Andean grain), quinoa, etc. She is requesting a loan of 1,000.00 soles to purchase more of the same types of products. Her dreams for the future include owning her own home in Ilave, and to improve her business. What she enjoys most about belonging to a cooperative bank is the ability to save, and the punctuality of the members at the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato flour, potato, cañihua (an Andean grain), quinoa, etc.

loans.name: Neri Olga

texts.es:
La señora Nery es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” desde hace 5 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores.
Nery nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar un carro que le servirá para el traslado de sus animales.
Su sueño para el futuro es comprarse carros y vivir tranquila con su familia.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Nery has been a member of the “Gregoria Apaza” cooperative bank, located in the Ilave district of the El Collao province, in Puno, for 5 years. She is 30 years old, married, and has 2 children. She completed her secondary school studies, and dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of small animals. Nery tells us that, with her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles from the Manuela Ramos Movement, she was able to augment her working capital. She is requesting a loan of 2,000.00 soles, with which to buy a car that would help her to transport her animals. Her dreams for the future include purchasing a car, and living peacefully with her family. What she enjoys most about her cooperative bank is the ability to save money.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a car.

loans.name: Epi

texts.en:
Epi is 59 and married with 3 children (ages 25-38).  She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.    Epi needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2009, Epi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Epi's 1st loan with SPBD. 

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. 

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15 

The following social metrics for Epi are provided by SPBD:
Overall Social Metric Score:               1.8 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. 

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Juana De La Paz

texts.es:
La señorita Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la artesanía.
Juana nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 2,700.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar bayeta, lana e hilos.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda de artesanías.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Juana has been a member of the communal bank "Gran Poder" for three years. She is from the Llave district in the province of El Collao, part of the Puno department. She is 24 years old, single, and has no children. She completed her high school studies and is a crafts artisan.

Juana tells us that with her first loan of S/. 300 from Movimiento Manuela Romos she increased her business capital.

She is requesting a loan of S/. 2,700 ($950) so that she can buy cloth, wool, and thread.

Her dream for the futre is to have a crafts store.

What she likes most about the communal bank is that the members are punctual for the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, wool, and thread

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 10 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió primaria completa y se dedica a la elaboración de panes.
Julia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar harina, azúcar, manteca y leña.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave, mejorar su negocio y tener su horno propio.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Julia has been a member of the communal bank "Gran Poder" for 10 years. She is from the Llave district in the El Collao district of the Puno department. She is 26 years old, married, and has 2 children. She completed her primary education and is a baker.

She is requesting a loan of S/. 2,000 ($700) with which she will buy flour, sugar, butter and firewood.

Her dream for the future is to have her own house in Llave, improve her business, and have her own oven.

What she likes most about the communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, butter, and firewood

loans.name: Alba Nelly

texts.es:
La señora Alma Nelly H. se dedica a elaborar deliciosas tortillas en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur donde tiene cuatro años de dedicarse a esta actividad con mucho ahínco con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

Ella siempre se ha dedicado a ser ama de casa pero al ver la necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida, inició esta actividad. El crédito lo solicita para mejorar el local donde elabora y vende las tortillas ya que necesita reconstruir ese local para ampliarlo y así llegar a tener un buen establecimiento donde sus clientes se sientan satisfechos al llegar a comprar las tortillas. También una parte del crédito lo utilizará para la compra de ropa con el fin de venderla y así generar utilidades para mejorar su localidad donde vende las tortillas.
texts.en:
Señora Alma Nelly H. works making delicious tortillas in the town of San Rafael del Sur. She has been doing this for 3 years, with much eagerness, for the purpose of supporting her home. She has always been a housewife, but when she saw the necessity to improve her living conditions, she began making tortillas. The loan she is seaking is to improve the area where she makes and sells tortillas as she needs to reconstruct it to expand it to have a good establishment where her clients sit satisfied after buying her tortillas. She will also use part of the loan to buy clothes with the view to seling them, and in this way generate utilities to improve her location where she sells the tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the area where she makes tortillas

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie U. is 30 and married with 4 children (ages 6-11).  She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.    Annie needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Annie joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Annie's 2nd loan with SPBD. 

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. 

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15 

The following social metrics are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:               1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. 

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: o purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Yanet Giovana

texts.es:
La señora Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” desde hace 2 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales de la región.
Yanet nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar cereales como: chuño, papa, avena, quinua.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Arequipa y abrir una tienda de abarrotes. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Yanet has been a member of the communal bank "Gregoria Apaza" for 2 years. She is from the Llave district in the El Collao province of the Puno department. She is 28 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child. She completed her secondary education and buys and sells local cereal grains.

She is requesting a loan of S/. 3,000 ($1,050) with which she will buy cereals and tubers such as: traditional freeze-dried potatoes (chuños), potatoes, oats, and quinoa.

Her dream for the future is to have her own house in Arequipa and to open a grocery store.

What she likes most about the communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy quinoa, another similar grain, traditional freeze-dried potatoes, potatoes, and oats

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita O. is 39 and married with 11 children.  She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.    Makerita needs a loan of WST $750 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 280 talas or US $117 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Makerita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Makerita's 1st loan with SPBD. 

The following social metrics for Makerita are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:               1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. 

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15 

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. 

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxom

loans.name: Briceyda Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Briceyda A. se dedica arduamente a laborar como maestra en un colegio ubicado en Managua donde a diario desde muy temprano inicia dando clases a los alumnos destacándose como una buena maestra que vela por el desarrollo intelectual de los estudiantes.

Ella es casada y tiene un hijo en edad escolar al que tiene que mantener y brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. Ella tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda y para esto solicita un crédito porque requiere comprar los materiales de construcción para mejorar dichas condiciones. Ella en este momento mejorará las condiciones de un cuarto y baño para que la familia tenga un mejor lugar donde vivir y así contribuir a su desarorrollo.
texts.en:
Briceyda A. is a dedicated teacher at one of Managua's schools. She begins her work day early in the morning teaching her students being notweworthy for the dedication she puts into caring for the intellectual development of her students. She is married and the mother of a school-age son who she must support and provide the conditions necessary for his development. She needs to make some home improvements and requires financing to buy the materials. She plans on this occasion to make improvements on a bedroom and bath so that the family can have a better place to live and thus contribute to their development.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso G. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito con el cual pudo impermeabilizar el techo de su casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder cambiar el piso al frente y pintar el exterior de la vivienda, ya que está en muy malas condiciones. 
Don Alfonso planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo de su trabajo en una agencia aduanal en el departamento de mensajero, ya que sus hijos le ayudan con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Señor Alfonso G. is very thankful for the cooporation for his previous loan, with which he was able to waterproof the roof of his house. He is seeking a loan to be able to change the front floor and paint the exterior of his home, as it is in a very bad condition. Don Alfonso plans to repay the loan with his wage from his work in a customs agency in the courier department, as his children now help him with the household costs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the front floor and paint the house exterior

loans.name: Albina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora ALBINA ISABEL A. D. V. tiene 51 años, vive en el distrito D. MOCHE , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN D. FATIMA . 
La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to D. primaria, es casada y tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales 1 depenD. económicamente D. ella . 
La socia se dedica a la venta D. menús que prepara para posteriormente repartirlos. 
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprò golosinas, gaseosas y jugos para vender en su casa y surtir su tienda.
