En la actuaslidad solicitarà un crédito D. 500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà insumos alimenticios como: arroz, papas, menestras, fideos, aceite, etc. para la preparación D. sus menús. Ella sueña con tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Albina is 51 years old and lives in the Moche district of the Trujillo province in the La Libertad department of Peru. She belongs to the communal bank "Virgen D. Fatima".

This member of the bank studied up to the fifth graD. of primary school, is married, and has 6 children of which one is still economically dependent on her.

The member prepares food which she then delivers to people.

With her first credit of S/. 300, she bought sweets, sodas, and juices to sell from her home and stock her store.

She is currently requesting a loan of S/ 500 ($175) with which whe will buy food supplies such as: rice, potatoes, soups, noodles, oil, etc, for the preparation of her dishes. She dreams of having a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, potatoes, soups, noodles, oil, etc

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Con dos hijos que mantener y con las necesidades del hogar, muy esforzadamente la señora Estela G. trabaja para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia que requiere con mucho esfuerzo su apoyo para salir adelante en su desarrollo como personas en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur.

La señora Estela G. tiene la necesidad de invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para construir el muro frontal de su vivienda para dar mayor seguridad a su familia ya que actualmente ella cubre la parte frontal de su vivienda con trozos de árboles y con alambre de púa por lo que  necesita muy urgentemente levantar un muro de concreto y para ello requiere materiales de construcción como son bloques, arena, cemento, vigas, entre otros. Espera en que su crédito le será otorgado para llevar a cabo esta obra de mucho beneficio para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Estela G., who lives in the town of San Rafael del Sur, has two children and a home to support. She makes quite an effort to work toward improving her family's living conditions who need her help to get ahead and to develop as people. Estela needs to buy materials to build a front wall on her property so that her house will be more secure. Currently, she covers the front part of her property with tree trunks and barbed wire. It is urgent to build a concrete wall and she needs materials like concrete blocks, sand, cement, beams, etc. She hopes that the loan will be approved so that she can bring about this work which will be of much benefit for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosalia es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 1 año atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Estudió superior completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de carne.
Rosalia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrà comprar carne, y de esa manera aumentar su mercadería.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Rosalia has been a member of the communal bank "Gran Poder" for 1 year. She is from the Llave district, province of El Callao, department of Puno. She is 26 years old, married, and has three children. She went to high school and now buys and sells meat. Rosalia tells us that with the first loan she asked the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for was for S/. 500.00 nuevos soles. With it, she was able to increase her capital. She will ask for a loan of S/.500.00 nuevos soles with which she will be able to purchase meat, and thus increase her merchandise. Her dream for the future is to own her own home. What she likes the most about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURHASE OF PORK, LAMB

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Para reconstruir una vivienda se necesita mucha dedicación y mucho dinero por lo que se debe comprar los materiales de construcción. Sin embargo, la señora Flor R. le interesa muchísimo el bienestar de su familia y ella ha decidido invertir en la compra de dichos materiales de construcción porque reconstruirá su vivienda que ha estado en malas condiciones y así brindará mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Es por esta razón que solicita en Ceprodel un crédito oportuno para dar lugar a esta obra y así continuar en el desarrollo familiar. 

Ella se desempeña como maestra en un colegio de una comarca en Managua y busca la manera de continuar desarrollándose cada día hasta alcanzar su meta de construcción.
texts.en:
To reconstruct a house you need a lot of dedication and money, because you must buy the construction materials. Nevertheless, Señora Flor R. is very interested in the wellbeing of her family and she has decided to invest in the purchase of said construction materials, because she will reconstruct her home, which is in poor condition, and in this way provide better living conditions for her family. It is for this reason that she is seeking in Ceprodel a timely loan to allow this work, and in this way continue the development of her family. She holds a role as a college teacher in a region in Managua and looks for the way to continue developing each day until she reaches her construction goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Gloria María

texts.es: La señora Gloria María
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria is very grateful for the cooperation she received on her previous loan, which she invested in a greater variety of foods for her business.

Once again, she is soliciting your cooperation for a loan to invest in the business and buy more inventory and shop furnishings, in order to give employment to two more people

With the earnings she will obtain from this new investment in her business, she plans to pay off the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO INVEST IN INVENTORY AND SHOP FURNISHINGS

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La señora Olga es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desD. hace 2 años atrás, del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 46 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Estudió primaria incompleta y se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado.
Olga nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar ovejas.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar una vaca.
Su sueño para el futuro es comprar una casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Olga has been a member of the Lupakas Community Bank for two years in the District of Plicuyo, Province of Collao, Department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She attended but did not complete primary school and now works buying and selling livestock. Olga tells us that with her first loan of 500 PEN from Movement Manuela Ramos she was able to buy sheep. She will request a loan of 1,500 PEN with which she will be able to buy a cow. Her dream for the future is to buy a house and that her children have good jobs. What she likes most about her Community Bank is the savings plan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor Guadalupe M. esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual ya casi termina el cuarto.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder terminar la recamara que será para sus hijos. Ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material, el realizara la mejora ya que se dedica a la construcción.
Con el ingreso que genera de sus trabaja planea pagar este crédito, los gastos familiares serán cubiertos con las pensión que recibe.
texts.en:
Guadalupe M. is very grateful for your cooperation in the previous loan with which the room is almost finished. He is asking for a loan again to be able to finish the bedroom which will be for his children. Since he doesn't have the necessary money right now to buy the materials, he will do the home improvement himself since he works in construction. He plans on paying for this loan with the earnings from his job. The family expenses will be covered by the pension he receives.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing the room and putting in doors and windows

loans.name: Graciela Lucina

texts.es:
La señora GRACIELA LUCINA H. C. tiene 41 años, vive en el distrito de MOCHE , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN DE FATIMA . 
La socia presenta estudios superiores de secretariado ejecutivo, es casada y tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella . Graciela se dedica a realizar manualidades, trabajos en telas, hilos , lanas, cuero ,etc. y adicionalmente a ello también dicta clases de manualidades.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò materiales como: telas, hilos, cuero , lanas, mostacillas, lentejuelas, pegamento, etc.  para realizar cojines, carteras , almohadas, etc.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà cuero al por mayor para hacer carteras.
Ella sueña con poder exportar sus manualidades al extranjero.
texts.en:
Mrs. Graciela Lucina H. C. is 41 years old, lives in the Moche District, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the Virgin of Fatima Community Bank. This member has completed advanced studies for executive secretary, is married, and has two children who are economically dependent on her. Graciela works making handicrafts using cloth, yarn, wool, leather, etc. She also gives classes in handicrafts. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought materials such as cloth, yarn, leather, wool, beads, sequins, glue, etc. for making cushions, wallets, briefcases, pillows, etc. Now she needs a credit of 500 PEN with which she will buy leather at wholesale to make wallets and briefcases. She hopes to be able to export her handicrafts to other countries.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leather at wholesale

loans.name: Acela

texts.es:
La señora Acela es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desD. hace 3 años atrás, del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 7 hijos. Estudió secundaria incompleta y se dedica a la artesanía.
Acela nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar lana, bayeta e hilos.
Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar su negocio y tener su propio capital.
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Acela has been a member of the Lupazas Communal Bank for three years. It is in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 48, married, and has seven children. She has some high school education. She works with handicrafts. Acela tells us that she used the first loan she asked the Manuela Ramos Movement for, 500 PEN, to increase her capital. She will now ask for a loan for 2,000 PEN to be able to buy wool, fabric, and thread. Her dream for the future is to increase her business and to have her own capital. What she likes best about her communal bank are the savings and the meetings with the members.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool, fabric, and thread

loans.name: Pelepesite

texts.en:
Pelepesite P. is 45 and married with 5 children (ages 4-19).  She owns a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  Pelepesite has 3 years of experience in this business.  Pelepesite needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Pelepesite joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Pelepesite's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Pelepesite are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:              2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María De Lourdes S. ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntualmente
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder liquidar el funeral de su hijo, que sufrió un accidente automovilista mortal, en esté momento no contaba con el dinero necesario para poder darle sepultura a su hijo. Solicita su cooperación en este crédito, el cual planea pagar con su sueldo que obtiene del trabajo que tiene en un hospital como encargado del laboratorio de rayos X.
texts.en:
María De Lourdes S. has had a previous loan with FVP which she repaid on time. She is asking for financing to finish paying for her son's burrial expenses. He was killed in an automobile accident. At the time, she couldn't afford to pay to have him burried. She is asking for help with this loan which she plans to repay with part of her earnings working in a hospital's X-Ray lab.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Funeral Expenses

loans.name: Maria Magadalena

texts.es:
La señora MARIA MAGDALENA MARTINES S. D. G. tiene 50 años, vive en el distrito D. MOCHE , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN D. FATIMA. 
La socia presenta estudios secundarios completos, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente D. ella. 
Maria se dedica a la compra y venta D. carne, menudencia y fruta. 
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos S. comprò fruta, carne y menudencia al por mayor.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito D. 2,000.00 nuevos S. con los que comprarà carne, pollo, frutas y menudencia al por mayor para posteriormente venderla en la sierra una vez a la semana.
texts.en:
María Magdalena Martines S. D. García is 50. She lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Virgen D. Fatima Communal Bank. She has a high school education. She is in a common law marriage, and she has two children who are economically dependent upon her. María buys and sells meat, giblets, and fruit. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy fruit, meat, and giblets wholesale. She currently needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy meat, chicken, fruit, and giblets wholesale. She will then sell them in the mountains once a week.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, chicken, fruit, and giblets

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena R. ya ha tenido dos créditos con KIVA los cuales ha pagado puntual. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en su nuevo de negocio le lavado de automóviles, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia, ya que es madre soltera y tiene a dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad, desea darles lo mejor.
Con una parte de las ganancias del negocio planea pagar este préstamo. Ya que con esta inversión su el local estará mucho mejor  y podrá contratar a dos personas más para trabajar.
texts.en:
Magdalena R. has had two previous KIVA loans that she has repaid on time. She is requesting funds now to invest in her new car wash. This business is her family's sole source of income in that she is a single mother of two children who depend on her and she wants to provide them with the best. With part of her profits from the business she plans to repay this loan because this investment in her place will make it much better and she will be able to hire two more people to work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her new business.

loans.name: Jeny Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora JENY ELIZABET SÁNCHEZ A. tiene 39 años, vive en el distrito de MOCHE , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN DE FATIMA. 
La socia presenta estudios superiores de Obstetricia, es casada y tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. 
Jeny se dedica a la venta de menús que prepara para posteriormente repartir a los trabajadores de las fàbricas cercanas a su domicilio. 
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò productos cosméticos como: talcos, cremas, perfumes, labiales, colonias, etc.
Ella solicità un crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà productos alimenticios para la preparación de sus menús como: arroz, menestras, azúcar, fideos, papas, etc. 
Ella sueña con tener su restaurante.
texts.en:
Jeny Elizabet Sánchez A. is 39. She lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Virgen de Fatima Communal Bank. She has a college education in Obstetrics. She is married and has two children who are economically dependent upon her. Jeny sells food that she prepares. She later distributes it to the workers in the factories near her home. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought cosmetic products like powder, cream, perfume, lipstick, and cologne, etc. She is asking for a loan for 800 PEN to buy food products like rice, vegetables, sugar, noodles, and potatoes, etc., to make her menu items. Her dream is to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, vegetables, sugar, noodles, and potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Fiaola

texts.en:
Fiaola S. is 41 and married with 5 children (ages 3 - 16).  She owns a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  Fiaola has many years of experience in this business.  Fiaola needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Fiaola iss requesting an additional loan to expand her business as an ongoing activity to improve her family and support her children in terms of school fees.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Fiaola's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

You can view Fiaola's previous loan on Kiva at:  http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=93494

The following social metrics for Fiaola are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:               1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan” desD. hace 10 años atrás del distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 54 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 8 hijos. Francisca no estudió y se dedica a la compra y venta D. cereales.
Francisca nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital y así comprar habas, cebada y chuño.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar cañihua, quinua, tunta, cebada y habas.
Su sueño para el futuro es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que màs le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Francisca has been a partner of the communal bank "San Juan" for 10 years now. She is from the district and province of Yunguyo in the department of Puno. She is 54 years old, married, and has 8 children. Francisca did not attend school, and she makes a living by purchasing and selling grains. With the first loan she solicited from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, of 300.00 nuevos soles, she was able to increase her capital and thereby purchase beans, barley, and potato flour. Now she is requesting a credit of 1000.00 nuevos soles, with which she will be able to buy cañihua, quinoa, tunta, barley, and beans. Her dream for the future is for her children to become professionals. The thing she likes most about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potato flour, cañihua, quinoa, tunta, barley, and beans

loans.name: Senerita

texts.en:
Senerita L. is 55 and married with 8 children (ages 14 - 34).  She owns a business venture, providing general clothing services to local community members.  Senerita has 3 years of experience in this business.  Senerita needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2007, Senerita joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Senerita's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

You can view Senerita's previous loan on Kiva at: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=18742

The following social metrics for Senerita are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Isela

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, la señora Isela C. se ha dedicado a laborar mucho para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y para mantener a su familia que depende de ella. 

Actualmente, la señora Isela busca la manera de cómo mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y lo más ideal y que tiene la necesidad es de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y para ello solicita el crédito para dar lugar a la reconstrucción en especial, la localidad donde tiene su cocina ya que no está en buenas condiciones por lo que decidió iniciar esta obra para sentirse muy satisfecha con este logro y lograr que sus hijos se sientan alegres.
texts.en:
Isela C. lives in the town of San Rafael del Sur. She has always worked very hard to bring sustenance to her home and to support her family that depend on her. Currently, she would like to improve her children's quality of life and the most ideal way of doing this is to make improvements on her dwelling. She is requesting financing to bring about these improvements, especially in the kitchen which is not in very good condition. This is why she decided to start this project so that she can feel satisfied with her achievement and see that her children feel cheerful.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Patricia C. está muy agradecida por la cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo elaborar la barda alrededor se su casa. 
Solicita el préstamo para la colocación del portón al frente de la vivienda, desea que su familia y sus bienes estén seguros.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su empleo en una maquiladora. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la hermana de la señora Sandra Patricia, viven en el mismo domicilio y su hermana le ayuda a cuidar los niños cuando está trabajando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra Patricia C. is very appreciative of the previous loan that helped her build the wall around her house. She is asking for a loan to install a door at the front of her house, to keep her family and possessions are safe. She intends to pay for the loan with the income she receives from her work in a maquiladora. The person who appears in the photo is Sandra Patricia's sister, who helps take care of the children when she is working.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction and installation of a front door for the house

loans.name: Rosa E

texts.es:
La señora ROSA E A. R. tiene 64 años, vive en el distrito de MOCHE , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN DE FATIMA . La socia presenta estudios secundarios completos, es casada y tiene 5 hijos todos mayores e independientes. 
La socia se dedica a la venta de quesos, roscas, manjar blanco , quesillos, yogurt, etc . 
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò quesos, quesillos, roscas y manjar blanco al por mayor.
Ella solicitarà un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que tambièn comprarà productos lácteos como: quesos, quesillos, yogurt, roscas, etc. para luego distribuir a sus clientes y a los diferentes mercados. 
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa E A. R. is 64 years old and lives in the district of Moche, province of Trujillo, and department of La Libertad in Peru. She belongs to the communal bank "Virgen de Fatima". Our partner has completed secondary education, is married, and has 5 children, who are grown up and independent. She makes a living by selling cheese, bread rolls, caramel spread, yogurt, etc. With her first credit of 300.00 nuevos soles she purchased cheese, rolls, and caramel spread wholesale. Now, she is requesting another loan of 300.00 to buy the same products, to later distribute them to her clients and to different markets. Her dream is to increase her sales and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheese, caramel spread, bread rolls, yogurt, etc. for her business

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora  PATRICIA DEL CARMEN V. S. tiene 30 años, vive en el distrito de EL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal CARIDAD II. 
La socia presenta estudios superiores incompletos de ventas y marketing, refiere que dejò de estudiar por faltad de recursos económicos. Patricia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo y actualmente espera otro bebè. Ella se dedica a la crianza de patos para su posterior venta en el mercado. 
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò patos bebès para criarlos y a su vez alimento balanceado.
En la actualidad solicitarà un crédito de 1,000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà patos bebes para criarlos y comprará tambièn alimento balanceado al por mayor.
Patricia sueña con tener una tienda de alimentos en su domicilio para generar mayores ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Patricia Del Carmen V. Saldaña is 30 years old and lives in the district of El Porvenir, province of Trujillo, and department of La Libertad in Peru. She belongs to the communal bank "Caridad II". Our partner has had some higher education in sales and marketing, but she quit studying due to a lack of economic resources. She is a live-in partner and has one son, but she is currently expecting another child. She makes a living raising ducks, to later sell them in the market. With her first credit of 300.00 nuevos soles, she purchased baby ducks to raise and also balanced feed for them. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 1,000.00 nuevos soles, with which she will buy more baby ducks to raise and will also buy feed wholesale. Patricia's dream is to have a food store in her home in order to generate a greater income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens, ducks, and balanced feed wholesale

loans.name: Fany Ignacia

texts.es:
La señora Fany es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Juan”, en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo.
Estudió primaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año atrás y su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de ovejas y gallinas.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.600.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà dos ovejas cara negra.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener su casa en Yunguyo y poder capitalizarse.
Lo que màs le gusta de su organización es el ahorro y la puntualidad que hay en cada reunión.
texts.en:
Fany is a partner of the communal bank "San Juan", in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the department of Puno. She is 26 years old a single mother with one son. She has completed her elementary education and makes a living by purchasing and selling livestock. For one year now, she has worked with El Movimiento Manuela Ramos, and her first loan was for 500.00 nuevos soles, which helped her purchase sheep and chickens. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 600.00 nuevos soles, with which she will buy black faced sheep. Her desire for the future is to have a house in Yunguyo and be able to capitalize. The things she likes most about her organization are the savings and the punctuality for every meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two black faced sheep

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
A sus 28 años de edad, la joven Jessica B. se ha destacado por ser estudiante preparándose para llegar a ser una gran profesional y así abastecer las necesidades de su hogar ya que ella es una persona muy responsable que vela por el bienestar de su familia.

Anteriormente ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel los que han sido destinados para mejorar su vivienda que ha estado en malas condiciones pero el crédito que solicita actualmente es para invertirlo en los gastos universitarios y esencialmente en la tramitación de su título y así lograr sus sueños de llegar a ser una gran profesional y una persona de éxitos.
texts.en:
At the age of 28, Jessica B. has distinguished herself as a student preparing herself to become a skilled professional, able to meet the needs of her household and a responsible person who looks out for her family's well being.

She previously took out loans with Ceprodel which were used to improve her home which was in poor condition. The loan she is currently applying for will be used to pay her university expenses and specifically for her degree processing (documentation), in order to achieve her dream of becoming a successful professional.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University degree processing

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La señora Aurelia es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Juan”, en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 9 hijos.
Aurelia no estudió y se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años atrás y su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1,500.00 nuevos soles con el que comprarà animales vacunos como un toro.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener su ganado propio y ya no pedir prèstamos.
Lo que màs le gusta de su organización son las reuniones y la puntualidad con las socias.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a partner of the communal bank "San Juan", in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the department of Puno. She is 50 years old, married, and has 9 children. She did not attend school and makes a living by purchasing and selling livestock. For 3 years she has worked with El Movimiento Manuela Ramos, and her first loan was for 300.00 nuevos soles, which helped her increase her capital. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 1,500.00 nuevos soles, with which she will purchase a bull. Her desire for the future is to have her own livestock and no longer ask for loans. The things she likes most about her organization are the meetings and the punctuality of her partners.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La señora Elisa es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 5 años, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales de la región.
Elisa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar papa, chuño, tunta, cebada, cañihua, quinua, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave y su propio capital par continuar trabajando.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Elisa has been a member of the "Gran Poder" (Great Power) Village Bank for five years. She lives in the Llave District, El Collao Province in the Department of Puno. She's 30-years-old, married, and has one child. She is educated through secondary school and earns her living buying and selling cereals in her region. She tells us that she used her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement, for 300 soles, to increase her capital. She's seeking a loan for 2,000 soles which she'll use to buy potatoes, chuño (dried potatoes), tunta (white chuño), barley, canihua (similar to quinoa), quinoa, etc. Elisa's dream for the future is to have her own house in Llave and her own capital to continue working. What she likes most about her village bank is how punctual the members are when attending meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, chuño (potato flour), chuño (white chuño), barley, canihua, and quinoa

loans.name: Juan Boanerge

texts.es:
En el municipoio de San Rafael del Sur en la ciudad de Managua, el señor Juan G. se dedica a trabajar como guarda de seguridad siendo este trabajo muy cansado pero él está comprometido con el bienestar de su familia y por esto es que trabaja fuertemente para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Actualmente atraviesa una gran necesidad en su hogar y es que su vivienda ha estado en malas condiciones y para ello ha iniciado a mejorar su vivienda y está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción como hierro, cemento y bloque para llevar a cabo esta obra de mucha necesidad para él y su familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality San Rafael del Sur, in the city of Managua, Mr. Juan G. works as a security guard. This job is very tiring but he is committed to the well being of his family. For this reason, he works very hard in order to support his household.

At the moment, he has a great need in his home. His home has been in bad state and he has started to make improvements. He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials like iron, cement, and cinder block in order to carry out the much needed repairs for Juan and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy iron, cement and cinder block

loans.name: Julia Ines

texts.es:
La señora JULIA INES SÁNCHEZ D. MARTINEZ tiene 73 años, vive en el distrito D. MOCHE , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN D. FATIMA . 
La socia presenta estudios hasta 6to D. Primaria, es casada y tiene 1 hija mayor e independiente. 
La socia se dedica a atender la bodega que tiene en su casa. 
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprò arroz, azúcar, leche, jugos, golosinas, etc. para surtir su tienda.
Ella solicitarà un crédito D. 800.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà productos alimenticios como: fideos, golosinas, aceite, leche, gaseosas, etc. para abastecer su tienda y así con lo que sus clientes soliciten.
Ella sueña con ampliar su tienda y aumentar sus productos.
texts.en:
Julia Ines Sánchez D. Martinez is 73. She lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Virgen D. Fatima Communal Bank. She has a sixth graD. education. She is married, and she has a grown and independent daughter. She works in the convenience store she has in her house. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought rice, sugar, milk, juice, and sweets, etc. to stock her store. She will ask for a loan for 800 PEN to buy food products like noodles, sweets, oil, milk, and soft drinks, etc. to stock her store with her customers’ requests. She dreams of expanding her store and increasing her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy noodles, sweets, oil, milk, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Andrea Maximina

texts.es:
La señora  ANDREA MAXIMINA R. D. R. tiene 53 años, vive en el distrito deL PORVENIR, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal CARIDAD II. La socia presenta estudios  hasta 6to D. primaria, refiere que es D. la sierra y que desD. niña se dedicó a trabajar en el campo, está casada y tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales 2 dependen económicamente D. ella. La socia se dedica a realizar manualidades como tejidos y bordados que los importa al interior del país.
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles, comprará cosméticos como: colonias, perfumes , cremas, talcos, etc.
Con este crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles, piensa comprar lana al por mayor para atender los pedidos D. chompas, bufandas, guantes, chales, etc que tiene pendientes por enviar. Ella sueña con exportar sus manualidades al extranjero.
texts.en:
Miss ANDREA MAXIMINA R. D. R. is 53 years old, she lives in the EL PORVENIR district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department in Peru. She is a member of the Communal Bank CARIDAD II. This member has a 6th graD. primary school education, she is from the mountain and since she was little she worked on the field. She is married and has 6 children, 2 of whom are still economically dependent. The member is now dedicated to artcrafts like embroidery and knitting. She imports these to the interior of the country. With her first credit of 300.00 new soles, she will purchase cosmetics such as:colognes, perfumes, creams, powders, etc. With this credit of 300.00 new soles, she will also purchase wholesale wool to meet the requests for pending scarfs, mittens, shawls, sweaters, etc. She dreams of exporting her crafts outsiD. of Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE WHOLESALE WOOL

loans.name: Paula  Marlene

texts.es: La señora Paola T. tiene 57 años de edad, procreo tres hijos ahora ya mayores de edad, que junto con su esposo han apoyado, su esposo de profesión ingeniero y por gracia a Dios lograron hacer su casa, y ahora doña Paola ha logrado tener su propio negocio de venta de ropa usada pues compra la paca y viene variedad de ropa bonita, el cual da a precio favorables, cuando inicio lo hizo con dinero propio y con la necesidad de tener sus propios ingresos para seguir apoyando  a sus hijos en lo que pueda aunque ellos sean independiente están los nietos, el cual espera ayudar a darle una buena educación, ha venido obteniendo mas clientes, es por eso desea comprar mas pacas de ropa donde venga zapatos, colchas, juguetes y ropa para  ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes como captar la atención de nuevos clientes. Contenta por financiamiento que espera poder lograr el objetivo de vender más para obtener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Mrs. Paola T. is 57 years old and has three adult children whom she and her husband supported throughout their youth. Her husband is an engineer, and together they were able to build a house for their family. Now, Paola has her own business selling used clothing, which she buys by the bundle. A variety of nice clothing comes in each bundle, and she sells each item for a fair price. She started the business with her own money, with hopes of generating her own income in order to continue to support her children as best she could. Though her children are now independent, she still wants to help provide her grandchildren with an education. She has been able to grow her client base, bit by bit, and so is looking to buy more bundles of clothing in order to catch the eye of more new clients. She is pleased with the opportunity to take out this loan, and hopes to sell more merchandise so that she can earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bundles of clothes in order to offer customers a wider variety of used clothing

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Luis B. se dedica a la actividad de carpintería habiendo adquirido gran experiencia en este ramo por lo que ha trabajado en esto con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su hogar.

El señor Luis es padre de dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos está a su cargo en conjunto con su cónyuge y es su deber llevar el sustento su mesa para que ellos se desarrollen y tengan un mejor nivel de vida.
  
El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de la madera y una herramienta de carpintería para realizar trabajos de primera calidad optimizando tiempo y logrando la satisfacción de los clientes los cuales le solicitan trabajos diversos como construcción de roperos, mesas, sillas, camas, cunas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis B. is a very experienced carpenter, and supports his family with the work that he does. Luis is the father of two children, one of whom is in his custody. It is his responsibility to put food on his family's table so that they can develop on a personal level and achieve a higher quality of life. The requested loan will be used to buy wood and carpentry tools so that Luis can realize high-quality workmanship, making the most of his time and leaving his customers satisfied. His customers request a wide variety of furniture from him, including dressers, tables, chairs, beds and cradles.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood and carpentry tools

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ivania es una mujer trabajadora y con mucho deseos de poder terminar de construir su casa, tiene 39 años de edad, procreo tres hijos los cuales los tres cursan sus estudios, su esposo es contador pero esta desempleado y solo con la pequeña pulpería sean estado ayudando, pero se ha descapitalizado, es por eso con este financiamiento lograra invertirle en: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, leche, lácteos, pollo, golosinas, gaseosas y poder aumentar las venta como sus ganancias para poder subsistir y poder seguir apoyando a su esposo que espera que pronto logre ubicarse en otro empleo. Ya que son tres hijos los cuales hay que apoyar para que logren una buena educación. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo que como muchas familias Nicaragüenses podemos a salir adelante cuando se nos presenta la crisis económica del desempleo, u otra crisis.
texts.en:
Ivania is a hard-working woman who dreams of finishing construction on her house. She is 39 years old and has three children, all of whom are in school. Her husband is an accountant by trade, but he is currently unemployed, so her small grocery store is their family's only source of income. Her business is currently understocked, however, so this loan will allow her to invest in the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, dairy products, chicken, candy and soda. She will then be able to sell more merchandise and earn more in profits so that she can sustain her family and support her husband while he finds another job. She has to support her three children so that they can get a good education. She is thankful to Afodenic for supporting many Nicaraguan families like hers through the current economic/unemployment crisis as well as through other past and future crises.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, dairy products, chicken, candy and soda in order to offer a wider variety of merchandise and sell more items

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, la señora Luz G. se dedica desde hace nueve años al negocio de venta de ropa la que comercializa ambulantemente en una comarca llamada San Pablo donde visita a varias personas con el fin de vender la ropa para llevar el sustento a su casa.

Este negocio por ser ambulante, muchas veces se expone a la fatiga del sol y a recibir la lluvia pero a pesar de esto ella sigue trabajando porque está comprometida con el bienestar de su familia. El crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa y también en la compra de sandalias para comercializarlas en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the municipality of San Rafael del Sur, Luz G. has worked for nine years in her business selling clothes. She sells them as a traveling salesperson in a county named San Pablo, where she visits various people, offering clothes for sale in order to support her household. Because her business involves walking, she is often exposed to rain or becomes tired in the sun, but in spite of this, she keeps working because she is committed to her family's well-being. She is requesting a loan so she can invest the funds in purchasing clothes as well as sandals to sell in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothes to sell

loans.name: Leoncio De Maria

texts.es: Don Leoncio  M. es un hombre muy trabajor desde su juventud, atrabajado como vendedor ambulante de pulseras, gel para cabellos, chapas, pulseras cadenas, golosinas entre otros productos, tiene 47 años de edad, junto con su esposa procrearon cuatro  hijos de los cuales aun están estudiando para un porvenir mejor, ya que para ellos fue difícil terminar sus estudios debido a la falta de recursos económicos de sus padres. Su casa es muy humilde y ha ido poco a poco mejorando con el préstamo anterior compro zinc y reglones para cambiar el techo ya que estaba en  malas condiciones. Y con este financiamiento lograra comprar materiales de construcción como piedra, arena, cemento para hacer las divisiones y poder tener una privacidad junto sus hijos. La vida de el como la de su esposa no ha sido fácil, ella emigro al país de Panamá a trabajar como conserje ya que aquí se le había hecho difícil encontrar trabajo en su país. A un para el ha sido mas difícil por que tiene que cuidar a sus hijos y poder apoyarlo  así como trabajar para que no le falte nada, aunque ella envía remesa es una gran responsabilidad para el,  lo que  mas desea  es poder estar otra vez junto con su esposa que espera que regrese para quedarse. Agradecido con Afodenic ya que ha sido el apoyo para poder hacer las mejoras en su pequeña vivienda, y poder lograr un techo mejor cada día.
texts.en:
Leoncio M., 47, has been a very hard-working man since his youth. He has worked selling bracelets, hair gel, door locks, chain bracelets, sweets, among others. He and his wife had 4 children who are still in school preparing for a better future since the parents were unable to finish school for lack of economic resources. Their home is very humble and little by little he has been making improvements to it. With a previous loan he bought zinc metal sheeting and edging to replace the roof, which was in bad contidition. This financing will be used to buy building materials like rock, sand, and cement to put up some room divisions so that he and his wife can have some privacy from their children. His and his wife's life has not been easy. She emigrated to Panama to work as a caretaker because she hadn't been able to find work in her own country. His life hasn't been any easier either since he has to care for the children and work to support them; even though his wife sends some money home it's a big responsibility for him. What he most wishes for is to be reunited with his wife whom he hopes will return to stay. He is grateful to Afodenic because it has been the source of help to improve his small dwelling and have a better place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, cement and sand for home improvements.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, la señora María de Jesús E. es madre de dos pequeños hijos los que están a su responsabilidad y ha decidido proporcionarles un techo digno donde habitar para que puedan desarrollarse y estar satisfechos con su madre.

Por tales motivos ha iniciado el mejoramiento de su vivienda que tanto necesita de su colaboración y ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como lo son bloque, cemento y hierro con la finalidad de continuar con su obra y ver realizado su sueño de tener un lugar seguro donde habiten sus hijos felices.
texts.en:
In the town of San Rafael del Sur, María de Jesús E. is the mother of two young children for whom she is responsible. She has decided to provide them with a decent home to live in so that they can develop and be satisfied with their mother. For these motives, she began to improve her home which is in need of her help. She has requested a loan to buy construction materials including blocks, cement, and iron with the goal of continuing her work and realizing her dream of having a safe place where her happy children live.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua, el joven Mauricio T. como todo padre responsable ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para brindarle a sus dos hijos un techo digno donde vivir y para que gocen de bienestar en un lugar seguro. Trabaja actualmente en el área de mantenimiento técnico en un hotel y a diario desde muy tempranas horas va a su trabajo para buscar el sustento para su casa y continuar con la construcción de su casa que específicamente en estos momentos está levantando un cuarto.

Por esta razón espera en que su crédito sea otorgado para comprar los materiales de construcción como son el bloque y cemento y así continuar con esta obra.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, Mauricio T. like all responsible fathers has begun to improve the conditions of his home in order to offer a dignified place for his children to live where they can enjoy well being in a safe place. He works in the technical maintenance department of a hotel and goes to work very early to find the sustenance for his household and to continue with the construction of his home, where he is building a bedroom at this time.

For this reason he hopes that his loan is approved, so that he can buy construction materials like cinder blocks and cement in order to continue with this work.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of constuction materials like cinder blocks and cement

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es:
A sus 31 años de edad, la dama Noelia C. trabaja arduamente para beneficiar a sus hijos con un lugar digno donde vivir y para ello ha iniciado a repellar las paredes de su vivienda y también a pintarlas para que su casa se vea diferente y así sus hijos se sientan satisfechos con su madre.

Es por este motivo que solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la pintura ya que ella misma se está encargando de pintar para así continuar brindándole a sus hijos excelentes condiciones para vivir en un lugar que preste las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
Noelia C., 31, works very hard for the benefit of her children, providing them with a worthy place to live. She has begun to replaster and repaint the walls of her house so that it will look different and her children will be proud of their mother. She is requesting funds to buy paint which she, herself, will apply to the walls in order to continue to provide her children with excellent living conditions and to live in surroundings that have the necessary conditions for this.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint.

loans.name: Rosa Ángela

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, la señora Rosa M. se destaca por vender ropa ambulantemente en las calles del municipio ofreciéndola en diferentes lugares y exponiéndose al sol y a los días de lluvia. A su edad, ella continúa en su actividad porque ésta le genera el sustento para llevarlo a su casa de habitación y así suplir las necesidades de su hogar. 

También ella vende cosméticos los que son ofrecidos de igual manera en diferentes lugares ambulantemente. El crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa y algunos cosméticos para seguir ofreciéndolos y así generar ingresos para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Rosa M. is known around the town of San Rafael del Sur for selling clothing from her push cart. She travels around the streets offering her product, putting herself out there rain or shine. Even at her age, she keeps at it because it provides her the support she needs to keep up her house and provide the basic household needs. She sells cosmetics, too, traveling around the same way she does with her clothing. She is seeking a loan to purchase clothing and cosmetics so she can keep on selling products and generating income to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Ruth G. es una dama muy emprendedora que se desempeña como maestra de un colegio y también tiene un negocio de transporte por medio de triciclos que son trabajados en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur.

Ella, muy inteligentemente ha sabido llevar a cabo su actividad de transporte puesto que tiene dos triciclos y está pensando comprar uno nuevo. El crédito lo utilizará para darle mantenimiento y reparación a los dos triciclos que tiene para que continúen trabajando llevando a los pasajeros de un lugar a otro. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado eficientemente para continuar en la actividad de transporte por medio de sus triciclos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ruth G. is a very enterprising woman who works as a school teacher. She also has a moto-taxi business in the municipality of San Rafael de Sur.

She has been clever starting her business and now owns two moto-taxis and is thinking about buying another. She will use the loan for maintaining and repairing her two moto-taxis so that she can continue taking passengers from one place to another. She hopes to receive the loan so that she can continue running her business efficiently.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining and repairing her moto-taxis

loans.name: Kristy

texts.en:
Kristy P. is from the village of Saray , Iligan City. She is 35 years old. Kristy is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Kristy owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Kristy is just starting this business.

In 2009, Kristy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kristy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Kristy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Prak Y., 60, is married and works together with his wife and two of his children in the Takeo province. They grow rice at their farm that generates about US$2.50 each day for the family. They work very hard at the rice field. Prak Y. is asking for US$750 to purchase fertilizer and a plot of farmland. They see this as a profitable venture that will not only increase their income, but also raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and farmland.

loans.name: Joycelen

texts.en:
Joycelen F. is from the village of Rosevelt, Iligan City. She is 42 years old. Joycelen is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Joycelen owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Joycelen has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joycelen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joycelen is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Joycelen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El señor José Antonio Martínez Ibáñez, cliente distinguido de Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva, esta persona ha mostrado ser un cliente emprendedor y responsable ya que en sus créditos demostró ser cumplidor y responsable, como en los otros créditos requiere invertir en su negocio de barbacoa y distribución del pan dulce, en esta temporada que es la mas fuerte por el tiempo de invierno con su esfuerzo espera tener mas clientes para seguir vendiendo sus productos, ya que con este trabajo honesto el a podido mantenerse en estos tiempos tan difíciles de crisis para nuestro país.
texts.en:
José Antonio Martínez Ibáñez is a distinguished client of Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva. He has proven to be an enterprising and responsible client having shown himself to be responsible and true to his payment obligations. As with past loans, he needs to invest in his barbeque and sweet bread distribution business, especially during these Winter months when demand is at its highest. He hopes that his efforts will result in an increased number of customers so that he can continue to sell his product since this honest work has enabled him to support himself during this difficult time of economic crisis for our country.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Concepción Rodríguez N., quedó  viuda, emprendió su negocio de comerciante y con este negocio y su pensión se sostiene, ella solicitó un crédito para invertir en más productos para esta temporada de invierno ya que son días festivos y la gente busca productos para comprar y regalar. Se habló a sus referencias personales y ellas nos comentaron que la señora es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Ms. Concepción Rodríguez N. is a widow. She started her business as a shopkeeper and she is able to support herself with what she earns and a pension. She has asked for a loan to invest in additional products for the winter season when, because of the holidays, people are shopping for gifts and other items. We spoke to the personal references she gave us and they told us that she is a very hard working and enterprising woman.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in merchandise for the winter

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle C. is from the village of Rosevelt , Iligan City. She is 29 years old. Michelle is single. To make a living, Michelle owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Michelle is just starting this business.

In 2009, Michelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Michelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna H. is from the city of Maquilao Tagub City. She is 41 years old. Lorna is married and has 1 infant. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising fish for sale. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lorna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lorna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov S., 44, is a married mother of three children. She and her husband have established their own household in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. To generate a daily income, Nov S. receives small pieces of cloth from the garment industry and prepares them as sets for fees. She normally earns around $4 each day to contribute to her family’s living expenses. Her husband is shown near her in the picture above. He helps provide for the family by providing a taxi service. Recently, Nov S.’s husband has needed a trailer to connect to his existing motorcycle, which will allow him to pick up more customers than he previously could. Nov S. requested a loan of $600 to be used to buy a trailer.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle trailer

loans.name: Gloria Irma

texts.es: La señora Gloria Irma M. S. es una clienta distinguida de Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva, se le hizo un refinanciamiento del crédito porque ella mostró ser clienta cumplida con sus pagos, se hizo la verificación del proyecto anterior y se pudo observar la mejora en su vivienda, nuestra clienta ahora solicita un nuevo crédito para invertir en su negocio, de nombre “Abarrotes Penny” establecida hace 5 años, requiere invertir en la compra de productos de abarrotes para darles un buen servicio a sus clientes y tener en su negocio todo lo que el cliente solicita.
texts.en:
Gloria Irma M. S. is a distinguished client of the Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva. Her loan was refinanced because she demonstrated herself to be a client who completes her payments. They verified her previous project, and you could see the improvement on her house. She is now asking for a new loan to invest in her business, which is called “Abarrotes Penny”. It was established five years ago. She needs to buy grocery products to give her customers good service and to have everything that the customer asks for in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana D. is from the village of Rosevelt, Iligan City. She is 34 years old. Rosana is married and has 1 school-age child. To make a living, Rosana owns & operates a a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of dried fish in the local community. Rosana is just starting this business.

In 2009, Rosana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosana is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish and products to sell

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza C. is from the village of Rosevelt, Iligan City. She is 35 years old. Eliza is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Eliza owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of rice in the local community. Eliza has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Eliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business, buying more rice to sell

loans.name: Poung

texts.en: S., a long-time businesswoman, is a mother caring for two young school-aged kids. S. produces and sells snack foods to people who are her neighbors or passers-by in the village, and she earns approximately $5 per day. To meet the needs of her family a little more, her husband drives a motorbike taxi. S. is very busy at her business because she wants to have a lot of money to ensure that her family attains a comfortable living and especially that both her children get a high level of education. S. is taking out her loan to meet both purposes. She will buy a new motorcycle for her family’s traveling needs and purchase more raw ingredients and attractive equipment for her business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn C. is from the village of Rosevelt, Iligan City. She is 33 years old. Marilyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen S., 59, is a widow and resides in Phnom Penh City with one of her children. To make a living, she is involved in a business of producing Cambodian traditional cakes, earning an income of US $3 per day. The family is also assisted by one of her children who is a skillful tailor, earning an income of US $2 per day. These sources of incomes help cover the family expenses. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. loans.name: Byambajargal

texts.en:
Byambajargal Y. is a 33-year-old woman who lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2002, her family sold all of their livestock and moved from the countryside to the capital in hopes of improving their lives. 

As soon as Byambajargal settled in, she started her own small business selling flour at the local food market. She buys flour from wholesalers and resells it at retail to local residents. As her business grew, she increased her inventory to include rice and sugar as well. The family has a small second-hand, Korean-made vehicle with which Byambajargal's husband, Damdinsuren, transports her flour, rice and sugar from the wholesale market. To increase the household’s income, Damdinsuren also runs a taxi service in town.

Byambajargal is requesting a loan to purchase more flour to increase her inventory. She is a humble, shy and hard-working person. She says, "I have a dream to have my own grocery store one day to ensure my only son's future life."
 
About XacBank:

XacBank was founded in 2001 and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It was the first microfinance organization to be established in Mongolia, but it has now expanded to include mainstream commercial operations. 

XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: 

http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here: 

http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase more flour to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Chiv

texts.en:
