loans.name: Miregen

texts.en:
Miregen V. is from the village of D'ban, Calamba, Mis. Occ. She is 27 years old. Miregen is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Miregen operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including "kinasun" (small clams) and shrimp, in the local community. Miregen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2007, Miregen joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miregen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Miregen is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Miregen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Ruth Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs named their group 'Ruth'. They sell goods in the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown. In order to experience a faster growth in their businesses and personal lives, they have come to SMT, a partner of 'Shine on Sierra Leone' in Waterloo to seek a loan of SLL 2,000,000 (or SLL 500,000 each).

Isatu C. on the left is this group’s leader. She sells such market foods as oil, rice, onions, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste) and 'ogiri' (used in sauce). She has been in this business for more than ten years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy ten gallons of oil, one carton of Maggi and one bag of onions. As it is now, five gallons of oil costs SLL 100,000, a carton of Maggi costs SLL 115,000 and a bag of onions costs SLL 75,000. Isatu was born in Freetown thirty-nine years ago. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools respectively.

loans.use: Buy ten gallons of oil, one carton of Maggi, and one bag of onions

loans.name: Isak

texts.en:
Isak T. is 48 years old and married with three children. Isak sells dried fruits in the local central market. He has had this business for 5 years already. Dried fruits are very popular in Tajikistan. Any hostess has some in store for serving, in case guests arrive at the house. In addition, dried fruits are, as a rule, served during all important family occasions, such as wedding parties, birthday parties and the like. Considering the constant demand for his goods, Isak's business is quite successful and brings in a stable income for his family. Isak has a large and friendly family, who always try to help each other. Now, he wants to increase his stock of goods so as to be able to better meet the demands of his buyers. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of $1,500. He will spend the loan on the purchase of dried fruits in order to increase the range he has for sale. Isak has already demonstrated himself to be a good client and has a positive credit history. He would like to thank everyone for their support, and promises to pay back the loan on time.

texts.en: Sarah is married with three children and she is 28 years old. Her husband sells children's clothes and shoes. She is a hardworking woman and she sells for long hours to support her family. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She sells frozen foods and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more frozen foods and groceries to sell during this festive period. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
For the past 13 years, Umar has worked in agriculture and the raising of sheep. He raises sheep which he cares for greatly since thanks to them, he can cover his household expenses through the milk which he sells in the mornings. Umar showed us his animals with great happiness as his sheep were about to be vaccinated against the various sicknesses that affect that type of animal. For Umar, it is very important to work his land and raise his animals which is why he is currently seeking a loan in order to expand his business. This will help his family generate additional income. We appreciate your support for Umar’s projects.

loans.name: Enogiomwan

texts.en: Enogiomwan is 45 years old and a mother of four children. She is popularly called Madam Enogie. Her husband is a civil servant. She sells groceries at retail prices. Her customers are mostly neighbors, friends, and local residents. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. Madam Enogie is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She started this business eight years ago. She needs a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Annarose

texts.en:
Annarose S. is from the village of D'ban Calamba Mis. Occ. She is 26 years old. Annarose is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Annarose owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members. Annarose has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Annarose joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annarose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. Annarose is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Annarose from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

texts.en:
Joy sells used clothes, jewelry and sarongs to make a living and sells daily from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. There are people in her community that cannot afford new clothes. She hopes to own a boutique in the future.

Joy is 40 years old and married with five children. She is a smart and friendly woman. She needs a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more used clothes and sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Joy is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Osvaldo  Gaspar Ríos Fernández casado con la Sra, Mercedes Morinigo y padre de 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 6 años respectivamente, el cliente actualmente se dedica a la activación y venta de chips para telefonía celular, el mismo fue funcionario del Ministerio de Defensa y en el año 1998 renuncio a sus 10 años de antigüedad pues sus ingresos no le permitían mantener a sus entonces dos hijos y señora, ni mucho menos pretender una vida medianamente respetable, fue así que en ese mismo año se habilito el Departamento De ventas de lineas de la Empresa Núcleo Personal, mas tarde se habilito la venta de lineas de pre pagos y desde ese entonces el mismo se dedica por cuenta propia a la compra de chips para su posterior venta.
El Sr. Osvaldo manifestó al momento de solicitar el crédito que nunca había podido acceder a un crédito para ampliar su negocio por carecer de documentos suficientes que el exigían en las entidades financieras y bancarias, hasta la fecha que dio con la Fundación Paraguaya y el crédito le fue concedido para la habilitación del su primer local fijo en la ciudad de Lambaré donde ya cuenta con accesoR. para aparatos celulares ademas de las lineas para activación y venta de lineas de prepagos.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya la primera ayuda prestada y ya cuenta con su local de venta gracias a ella.
texts.en:
Osvaldo Gaspar Ríos Fernández is married to Mercedes Morinigo and the father of 3 children ages 12, 10, and 6, respectively. This client currently dedicates himself to the activation and sale of cell phone chips. He was previously on the staff of the Ministry of Defense. He resigned in 1998 after 10 years of service because his salary did not permit him to support his wife and his then two children, nor much less allow him to expect a life even halfway respectable. This is how, that same year, he joined the Sales Department of a personal electronics enterprise and then later started selling pre-paid lines. Since then, he has worked buying electronic chips to sell himself. Osvaldo states that he had never been able to expand his business until his loan through Fundación Paraguaya, because he lacked the necessary documents required by other financial entities and banks in order to obtain a loan through them. Once finally able to access credit, he obtained a site for his business in the city of Lambaré. His store is stocked with cell phone accessories as well as activation lines, and he also sells pre-paid lines. He is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for helping him with his first loan and, thanks to this help, he now has his own store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as:  cell phone activation chips.

loans.name: Badema Group

texts.en: Bendu K. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Badema. She is married with 3 children aged 20-23 years old, and their educational levels are 6th grade to high school graduate. Bendu is illiterate due to poverty. She and her family live in central Voinjama, and works in the central market of Voinjama City, the capital of Lofa county, northern Liberia. Her business is clothing. She buys used clothes wholesale and sells retail to other vendors in the Voinjama central market, Liberia. Bendu has been running this business for 20 years, and hopes to improve by having a store. She treats her customers well in order to encourage customers to continue patronizing her business. Bendu needs this loan to purchase more clothes to improve her business. She dreams of giving her family and kids the best support.

loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en: Manvel G. was born in 1965. He lives and works in Yegheg village, in the Kapan area. He is the manager of a household village school. Manvel is married and has 3 children: 2 sons and a daughter. One of his sons serves in the Armenian Army, and the second one studies at the Kapan Agricultural Institute in the juridical department. His daughter will finish high school next year. Manvel’s wife is a nurse at a hospital. All of Manvel’s family is engaged in bee-keeping. Bee-keeping takes a lot of time for its upkeep and development; in the summer months it requires approximately 8 hours per day, and in the other seasons 4 hours per day, but Manvel is not afraid of difficulties and he is very proud of his business. To increase his family’s annual income, Manvel needs a 1,050,000 AMD loan to buy a pickup truck to move his bee families from place to place depending on the season.

loans.use: To buy a pickup truck

loans.name: Laban Mburu

texts.en: Laban Mburu M. sells bananas with two employees out of a stall in the Mombasa market.  He has been in this business for the last six years, and manages the challenges of getting a good supply of bananas and strong competition from other grocery stores.  He would use a loan of KES80,000 to add to his stock of bananas.  Laban is married and has four children.  He describes himself as hardworking and dedicated to his work.  He dreams of educating his children and providing comfortably for his family.

loans.use: To buy bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fixing up a village pharmacy

loans.name: Falak

texts.en: Falak has worked as a home-based hairdresser since 2005. She is 21 years old and living with her parents and 4 brothers and sisters. They cooperate together to provide a good living situation for the family. Today, Falak is asking to borrow $1,200 to purchase cosmetics products and hair accessories in order to enlarge her business and be able to satisfy the needs of her clientele.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and hair accessories

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is 30 years old and owns Pamoja Repairs. He has been in the electronics services business for 12 years. With the KES 40,000 loan, Ezekiel wants to purchase materials, such as metals, for a Mnet machine. Ezekiel comes from very humble beginnings. He is married and has five children, who are all in school, between the ages of 2 and 16 years. He hopes to open more service stalls in the city.

loans.use: To buy materials and metals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Supplying her store with merchandise

loans.name: David Amos

texts.en: David Amos N.'s business is Kisii Soapstones Carvings, and he sells animal statues to tourists and local customers.  He has one employee and has been in this business for 11 years.  His biggest business challenge is breakage of statues due to poor packing and rough transportation. He would use the loan of KES70,000 to buy more soapstone.  He is married and has five children.  He describes himself as hardworking and friendly. He wants to educate his children and provide well for his family.

loans.use: To buy more soapstone

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana A. is married and has five dependents. She has received junior high education. Joana sells cement and other building materials and bags of  mineral water and so on at Teterem near Elmina, which she has been doing since 2005. Her husband is a trader. Joana uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Joana will use the loan to purchase more building materials including cement for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joana plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase building materials including cement for sale

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en: Mazen is a 35-year-old single man. He has been working as a tailor since 2002 and has 15 years of experience in this field. Today, Mazen is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy an additional sewing machine to be able to make more products because his business has developed remarkably and he needs to meet the requirements of his clients and to make a good income.

loans.use: To buy an additional sewing machine

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en:
Modupe is 52 years old and is a widow with seven children. Her youngest child is 18 years old. Modupe is a friendly woman and she is so determined to excel in her business and family life. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. 

Modupe has a stall where she sells foodstuffs and groceries at retail prices to her customers. Her customers are usually neighbors, residents and friends. She is requesting a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Modupe is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali has owned a shop in his town, since 2007. He sells CDs and DVDs. He’s 21 years old and he lives with his parents. He helps his father in the household. Today, Ali is asking to borrow $600 to buy more merchandise and to make some renovations to his shop.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and to make some renovations to his shop.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina T. is from the village of Nacional in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Rina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rina owns and operates a "sari-sari" general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Rina has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month through these activities.

In 2007, Rina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca A. sells hardware and building materials, such as cement, at Teterem, near Elmina.  Rebecca has completed junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader. Rebecca has been selling hardware since 2006. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy building materials to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy building materials to sell.

loans.name: Adijat

texts.en:
Adijat is 50 years old and is married with four children. Her youngest child is 10 years old. Her husband works in a government electrical company and he also supports the home.

Adijat is a smart and hardworking woman. She sells drinks and eggs at retail prices and hopes to own a shopping mall in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks and eggs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Adijat is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and eggs to sell

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita C. is from the village of Buenavista, Oroquieta City in Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Tita is single. To make a living, Tita owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, cooking oil, and canned goods in the local community. Tita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2008, Tita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Tita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Tita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina S. is from the village of Inasagan, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old. Celerina is single and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Celerina owns and operates a business venture that raises crops. While it is not the only means by which revenue is generated, the business' main source of income is from the planting and harvesting of bananas for sale. Celerina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008 Celerina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Celerina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This earlier loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Celerina is now requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Celerina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase an inventory of soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en:
Fumilayo is 46 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. Her eldest child is 25 years old. Her husband is a mechanic and he also supports the home.

Fumilayo sells medicines at retail prices to her customers and hopes to own a maternity home in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Fumilayo is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “ Kuña Guapa” se formó gracias al deseo de mejoramiento y superación del nivel de vida de sus integrantes ya que son personas de muy escasos recurso.

Utilizaran el crédito para diversas opciones de compra como ser: compra de insumos para la fabricación de comestibles( harina ,huevos,aceite,carne,condimentos,etc,) , compra de leche azúcar,yerba,harina,sal panificados y verduras, compra venta de melón, sandia , banana, naranja y frutas diversas para su posterior venta, compra de ropas de ocasión para la venta , compra-venta de calzados , compra-venta de productos cárnicos, compra-venta de lácteos,compra-venta de huevos etc, para tratar de aumentar los ingresos y mejorar su forma de vida.
La Sra. Silvia se dedica a la venta de comidas con una pequeña casilla en la vereda de su casa, ella se levanta muy temprano  a la mañana para preparar las comidas ya que sus clientes acuden al copetín desde las primeras horas del día.
Así Doña Silvia trabaja todos los días para sobrellevar sus compromisos con sus 5 hijos quienes ya están en edad escolar. Mediante la ayuda que brinda la fundación puedo hacer muchas cosas y mejorara el nivel de vida de mis hijos manifestó la misma.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa committee was formed thanks to the desire of the members to improve their quality of living since they had very scarce resources. They will use the loan for different purchases such as: raw materials in producing food (flour, eggs, oil, meat, condiments, etc.), milk, sugar, spices, salt, bread and vegetables, melons, watermelons, bananas, oranges and other fruits, formal event clothing, shoes, meat products, dairy products, eggs, etc. to try to increase their income and better their quality of life. Mrs. Silvia sells food from a small stand on the sidewalk in front of her home. She wakes up very early to start preparing the food as her clients start coming in in the early hours. So, Mrs. Silvia works every day to meet her commitments to her 5 children who are all of school age. Through the help that the foundation offers her, she tells us that she can do many things and improve the quality of life of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a wide variety of products for direct sale and for making food to sell

loans.name: Bendición Group

texts.en:
The women in this group use their loans to purchase varying items. Some use the money to buy lettuce, tomato, meat, bread, mayonnaise, oil and other items necessary for cooking pastries and meals to sell at lunch time. Others use it to purchase fabric, thread and buttons for making clothing, sheets and men's and women's garments. Yet others use their loans to buy soft drinks, wines, beer, lingerie, earrings, necklaces, chains and bracelets to sell.

Bendición Group was founded just two years ago with the help of another group that was working in the area. To date, members have learned to work together and meet deadlines, whilst bettering their business activities and helping each other with entrepreneurial advice. 

On average, each woman's loan is 537,500 PYG, which will be invested in the purchase of items to be sold in their respective commercial activities:

- Ceferina O. sells clothes. 
- Guillermina Ruiz D. sells ready-made food. 
- Mirtha R. sells clothes. 
- Joan J. sells drinks. 
- Mirian R. sells jewelry. 
- Juana J. sells ready-made food. 
- Luisa R. sells lingerie. 
- Sheila N. sells clothes. 
- Mirna M. sells clothes. 
- Barbara O. sells clothes. 
- Romina A. sells clothes. 
- Petrona C. is a tailor and seamstress. 
- Pabla J. sells ready-made food. 
- Mercedes G. sells clothes. 
- Eloisa G. sells ready-made food. 
- Lourdes Peña is a cleaning lady. 
- Estelvina P. sells drinks and cold beverages. 
- Andrea J. sells clothes. 
- Luisa J. sells clothes. 
- Antonia L. sells clothes. 
- Patricia V. is a hairdresser. 
- Lucia S. sells cosmetics. 
- Graciela V. sells clothes. 
- Mirian Z. sells cosmetics.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ana Eugenia

texts.es: LA SRA. ANA EUGENIA ES PASANAKERA O VENTA DE PRODUCTOS A PLAZOS CON CUOTAS COMODAS DIARIAS, TIENE 17 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA Y LOS CLIENTES VARIAN POR TEMPORADAS ES FIESTAS DE FIN DE AÑO AUMENTAN SUS CLIENTES YA QUE ELLA OFRECE SUS CANASTONES NAVIDEÑOS. ELLA ES UNA SEÑORA QUE DIA A DIA COBRA PUESTO POR PUESTO A LAS COMERCIANTES A LAS QUE LES VENDE PRODUCTOS DE USO MASIVO, POR EJEMPLO VIVERES, Y TAMBIEN LES OFRECE ARTICULOS COMO ELECTRODOMESTICOS, ROPA, LLANTAS PARA VEHICULOS Y OTROS QUE LE PIDAN, ELLA VIVE EN LA CASA DE SUS SUEGROS PERO YA TIENEN UN ESPACIO PROPIO DONDE VIVE CON SU ESPOSO Y SUS DOS HIJOS, ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Eugenia is an intermediary in the purchase and sale of products at favorable prices and financing terms. She has 17 years of experience and her customers vary depending on the season. During the end of year holiday season the customers increase, this is when she sells her Christmas baskets. She is a lady that collects from the vendors on a daily basis, the ones that she sells large scale items to, such as store supplies. She also offers appliances, clothing. automobile tires and other requested items. She lives with her in laws, where she has her own space where she resides with her husband and her two children. She is very hard working and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Concepcion Manuela

texts.en:
Ms. Concepcion Manuela is 63 years old and lives at home with her husband and her two eldest daughters. Her husband is a builder who specializes in constructing gutters (eavestroughs) at construction sites.

Manuela’s business is based around buying and re-selling clothing for men, women and children. She also sells small appliances, household goods and other items according to requests she receives from her customers.

The loan will help Manuela acquire a larger quantity of goods for this summer season, for the holidays, and for year-end, a season which is usually very high in orders and retail sales.

Manuela longs to build up her business through hard work so that she can retire and spend time in the company of her grandchildren, ensuring herself a prosperous and dignified future.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of goods

loans.name: Bovalagai Group

texts.en:
Princess D. K. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Bovalagai. She is single and has 2 children. Her children are aged 5-11 years old, their educational levels ar kindergarten to 3rd grade.

Princess is a high school graduate, but could not continue to university due to poverty. She and her children live in the Telbomai Quarter, but work in the Central market of Voinjama city, the capital of Lofa county, northern Liberia .
Her business is general goods. She buys general goods, wholesale, and sells retail in the Voinjama central market, Voinjama city Lofa County, Liberia. Princess has been running this business for 3 years, and is hoping to improve her business.

She serves her customers in a good manner in order to encourage customers to continue patronizing her business. Princess needs this loan to purchase more general goods to improve business. She dreams of having a house of her own.

loans.use: To purchase more general goods to improve business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has two children, both in school. She lives with her children and her husband in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area, in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the people. Beatrice trades in second hand clothes. 
She tells us that she buys from Accra and sells by hawking in her community. She also treks to sell in nearby communities. Beatrice has been in business for five years and wants a loan to purchase goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes.

loans.name: Lardi

texts.en:
Lardi is twenty-five years old. She is married and has two children, both in school. She lives with her children and her husband in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing business is the major occupation of the people. Lardi trades in second hand clothes for both males and females. 
She buys bales of second hand clothes from Accra and hawks them in her community. She also treks to sell in nearby communities. Lardi has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to purchase goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.en:
The women of the Esperanza committee will invest their loans in the purchase of vegetables, breads, milk, eggs, linens, perfumes, cosmetics, etc.

The committee is in its 5th loan cycle, continuing to grow and work at their shared ideals of hard work, prosperity and a secure future. 

Diana S. sells haberdashery.

Marina T. owns a pantry.

Rosalba B. cooks and sells food at a canteen. 

Hermelinda F. cooks and sells food at a canteen. 

Estela V. owns a candy store.

Alejandra R. cooks and sells food at a canteen. 

Antonia G. sells haberdashery. 

Isidora A. is a nurse. 

Mirtha Town sells jewelry.

Primitiva A. sells shoes. 

Francisca F. sells haberdashery. 

Maria A. sells perfumes. 

Sixta A. cooks and sells food at a canteen. 

Sebastiana R. sells clothes. 

Isidora S. owns a pantry. 

Aida I. sells clothes. 

Sonia M. cooks and sells food at a canteen.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and their children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the people. Maame is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice porridge. She hawks to sell in the mornings in her community. Maame has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice.

loans.name: Talata

texts.en: Talata is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the local people. She is a food vendor. Talata prepares and sells rice with stew. She sells on a tabletop by the road side in her community. Talata has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice, and other ingredients, in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice.

loans.name: Fidelina Caceres

texts.en: Fidelina Caceres G., 49, is married to Mr. Juan R. Ortiz. They started a small business selling consumer products 20 years ago and have made enough money to raise their daughter and give her the opportunity to pursue a university degree. Fidelina hopes her daughter will be able to finish university, with their support, and have a good career and future. Fidelina's business is located next to an autoservice station, so she has a steady flow of customers. She and her husband sell their merchandise at a good price and work to provide their clientele with good quality and convenience. They will invest their loan in purchasing more merchandise as the summer holiday season has started and it is a very busy time for business.

loans.use: Merchandise.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su décimo primer ciclo. Podemos hablar de la Sra. Carmen Cáceres con 35 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos tiene venta de productos  de limpieza en los almacenes del barrio de la ciudad de Lambaré  y en los puestos sanitarios y en otras localidades cercanas, lo realiza en la hora de la tarde  y regresa a su casa ya cuando oscurece .
Es una señora muy guapa y valiente porque lucha para el día a día y así poder salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.   
Lo que anhela  es tener su propio local. De esta manera ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de  sus dos hijos que estudian. 
Como ella las demás integrantes también realizan sus actividades diariamente así como: 
Nombre y Apellido
Actividad
Griselda T..Venta de merceria
Arminda A..Reciclajes
Silvia A..Venta de carbon
Mara luz C..Vta  de comida
Cynthia A..Venta de Ropas
Gladys T..Venta de frutas 
Antonia T..Venta de comestible

Rocio Gonzalez.Venta deAvon

Yolanda S..Venta de tortas
Mercedes Castiglione.Venta de ropas
texts.en:
The group is currently in their eleventh loan cycle. Let’s talk about Carmen Cáceres. She is 35, and she has three children. She sells cleaning products in the neighborhood stores in Lambaré. She also sells to bathroom locations and other nearby locations. She does this in the afternoons, and she returns home when it gets dark. She is a great and brave person because she fights day to day to get her children ahead. She is a single mother. She longs to have her own location. That way she could manage the household expenses and the educational expenses for her two children. She is like the other members who also work daily at activities like: Griselda T..Sells Notions Arminda A..Recycles Silvia A..Sells Coal Mara luz C..Sells Food Cynthia A..Sells Clothes Gladys T..Sells Fruit Antonia T.. Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, ingredients for food, cosmetics, and cleaning products

loans.name: Help Us Group

texts.en:
Siah Wollie is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Help us. She is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 1-13 years old. The children’s educational levels are kindergarten to 6th grade. 
Siah is illiterate due to poverty. She and her children live in the Telbomai Quarter, but work in the Central market of Voinjama city, the capital of Lofa county, northern Liberia . Her business is rice sales. She buys rice by bag and sells retail in the Voinjama central market, Voinjama city Lofa County, Liberia. Siah has been running this business for 3 years, and hopes to improve business to a store. She takes good care of her customers in order to encourage them to continue patronizing her business.
Siah needs this loan to purchase rice wholesale to improve business. She dreams of helping her children achieve their education.

loans.use: To purchase rice wholesale to improve business.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married and has a 19-year-old son, Yevgenyi. She lives in the town of Vodyanoye. Natalya owns two big spacious greenhouses and grows vegetables for sale at the market. She has been in farming for 8 years. Presently, Natalya has 30,000 Grivnyas invested in this project. She spends about 10,000 – 12,000 Grivnyas on seeds and clear polyethylene film every year. 

Natalya is seeking a 10,000 Grivnyas loan to construct a new greenhouse. A new greenhouse will increase the amount of produce she can offer for sale. Natalya is willing to work very hard to see her plans fulfilled. One of her personal goals is to generate enough income to build a garage, which has been a vital need for their family for awhile. 

Note: In the photo, Natalya is with her husband, a retired policeman.

loans.use: To construct a new greenhouse.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Hanna is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children and her husband in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the local people. Hanna is a trader. She trades in second hand footwear for both males and females. She buys the goods from Accra and sells by hawking in her community. Hanna also treks to sell in nearby communities. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to purchase her goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy footwear, in bulk.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married and has two grown children. She is an entrepreneur, from Vodyanoye, who owns 4 small greenhouses and grows vegetables for sale (i.e. tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes). Mariya launched her small business 30 years ago. Currently, her whole family is actively involved in this successful venture with a working capital of 60,000 Grivnyas. They spend 15,000-20,000 Grivnyas on seeds and clear polyethylene film every year.   

Mariya is requesting a 10,000 Grivnya loan to re-construct her regular greenhouse into an arch one with condensate control features. She believes this type of greenhouse design will be functional at both shedding snow and combating overhead drip. Mariya realizes that this type of business is very prosperous for her region and she is hoping to continue growing her business in the future.

loans.use: To re-construct her greenhouse.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is thirty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and their children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the local people. Rebecca is a trader. She trades in pastries. She bakes and fries meat pies and supplies to retailers and beverage sellers. Rebecca has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients, in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour in bulk.

loans.name: Florinda Agustina

texts.es: Doña Florinda  tiene 34 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Artesana “Elaboración de delantales típicos empleados, habita junto  a su Esposo, cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad,  lleva 8  años de confeccionar Delantales en los servicios ya mencionados su  residencia  se encuentra en el Paraje Xecaja del Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  por las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para poder comprar dicho Activo para movilizarse, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Florinda is 34 years old. She is married and works as an artisan making traditional women’s aprons. She lives in the Xecaja district, in the canton of Poxlajuj, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala.

Florinda lives with her husband, and has two employees working with her. She has been making aprons for eight years. Because of her current economic condition, she is not able to buy material to continue her business. For this reason, she is seeking a loan from ASDIR. In this manner, she will be able to increase her sales and help her family achieve a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for handicrafts

loans.name: Vyacheslav

texts.en:
Vyacheslav is married and has two sons. He is a businessman from Novomoskovsk. He owns two open fast food kiosks selling meat pastry, instant coffee, hot tea and baked goods. He has two vending locations at different markets in his hometown. Vyacheslav has a hired vendor who works at one of his fast food kiosks. Vyaheslav has been in this business for 11 years. His monthly net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas.  

Vyacheslav is seeking a loan of 16,900 Grivnyas to re-build his kiosks, installing roller shutters to keep him, and his hired employee, warm during the cold winter season. Food items are always in high demand, despite dead season tendencies. This is why Vyacheslav believes this type of business will keep bringing him profit. One of his long-term plans is to open more vending locations and to continue expanding his business in the future.   

Note: in the photo, Vyacheslav is with his hired employee.

loans.use: To re-construct his vending stands equipping them with plastic roller shutters.

loans.name: Geronima Dominga

texts.es: Doña Geronima G. tiene 56 años de edad, es casada de oficios Tejedora, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres”, habita junto  con su esposo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un pequeño Taller, de 2 Telares llevan 12 años ya  laborar   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xecaja del Cantón Poxlajuj del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Mrs. Geronima Gutierrez is 56 years old, married, and is a seamstress specializing in “Elaboration of Typical Styles for Women.” She lives with her husband and the two dedicate themselves to the same trade. They have a small shop, and for the last 12 years have worked in 2 shops. They live in Paraje Xecaja in Poxlajunj Canton, Department of Totonicapan, Guatemala.

Recently, demand from their customers has increased, but the economic conditions in which they find themselves are insufficient to increase their capital. For that reason, they approached the ASDIR Association to solicit a loan, with the intention of buying primary materials and in this way, to be able to increase sales. They also hope to advance their family and enjoy better conditions of life.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY PRIMARY MATERIALS FOR THE PRODUCTION OF ARTESANRY

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married. He has 3 daughters and a son. He lives in Novomoskovsk. Alexander sells bread and baked goods in his hometown. He uses high tech equipment, cheap power resources, a special dough formula and quality grain, which helps him have a favorable standing in this market. Alexander has another big advantage: one of his biggest competitors has just withdrawn from the market, leaving him more freedom to grow his venture. 

Alexander has been running this business for 2 years. His exclusive product and hard work have helped him make his business a success with about 150,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Alexander is seeking a loan of 14,500 Grivnyas to further develop his business and to make it run more efficiently.

loans.use: To develop his business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is twenty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and their children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the local people. Nancy is a trader. Her business is local soap production. Nancy prepares the soap out of soda, palm oil, and other ingredients, supplying it to retailers. Nancy has been in this business for ten years and wants a loan to buy soda and other soap manufacturing ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for soap making.

loans.name: Prince Kolawole

texts.en:
Prince Kolawole is 52 years old and married, with 5 children. His youngest child is 16 years old. His wife sells drinks to support him. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. He is an LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa.

Prince Kolawole sells firewood at retail prices to his customers, who are usually friends, residents and neighbors. The demand for his firewood is high and he hopes to meet this demand. He is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more firewood to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna is married. She is an entrepreneur from Korolyovo where she works in the local mall selling gifts and other retail items. Ganna has been in this business for 10 years. Her venture has grown up to 40,000 Grivnyas in inventory and about 4,000 Grivnyas in monthly profit. 

Ganna is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to diversify assorted merchandise she offers for sale in her outlet. This type of inventory is always in demand, especially during the holiday season. Ganna is hoping to generate additional income to spoil her family this Christmas.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is 52 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to five children. All have completed basic school but could not continue due to financial problems. Adwoa lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim, which is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the local people. Adwoa is a trader. She trades in foodstuffs such as yam, plantain, cassava, etc. She buys from nearby communities and treks to sell in nearby towns. She also supplies to local food vendors. Adwoa has been in this business for ten years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.fr: M. Alphonsine est née le 06 Mai 1951 au Bénin. Mariée à AYITONDJI Gaudens, Alphonsine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Alphonsine a deux autres enfants à charge, en plus de ses enfants. Alphonsine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Towéta à Cotonou (capitale économique du Bénin), depuis quatre ans déjà. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Alphonsine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Alphonsine vend du pain (sucré et salé) à Sainte Cécile à Cotonou. Alphonsine mène comme activité secondaire, la vente de tenues dames. Alphonsine s'approvisionne à Cotonou. Il y a 5 ans environs que Alphonsine mène cette activité de vente de pains. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre crédits auprès de l'institution. Les quatre crédits antérieurement obtenus ont été bien remboursés. Alphonsine connait en ces périodes, des difficultés financières. C'est pour renforcer son capital et agrandir davantage son activité, que Alphonsine sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Alphonsine M. was born on May 6, 1951 in Benin. She is married to Gaudens Ayitondji and is the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. Alphonsine also takes care of two other children in addition to her own. For the last four years, Alphonsine has been living with her husband and children in Toweta, a district of Cotonou (the economic capital of Benin). The couple supports the family together. Alphonsine did not attend school. In order to support herself and her children, she sells baked goods (sweet and savory) in the Sainte Cecile district in Cotonou. Her sideline commercial activity is selling women’s clothes. Alphonsine buys her stock in Cotonou. She has been selling baked goods for about five years. She is a former client of ALIDé and has previously obtained four loans from them. The four loans obtained earlier have been duly repaid. This was during the times when Alphonsine was experiencing financial difficulties. In order to bolster her capital and to increase her level of sales, she is seeking a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing baked goods (sweet and savory)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 42 years old. She is married and has four children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim, which is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the local people. Rose works hard to provide for the family. She is a trader, dealing in bags of charcoal. Rose buys from nearby communities and treks to supply nearby towns. She also sells to local restaurant operators. Rose has been in this business for seven years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Don Joaquín es un señor de 59 años está casado y tienen 6 hijos, son una familia de escasos recursos económicos, ya que los 3 hijos mayores solo han estudiado hasta la primaria, y actualmente se encuentran en la Republica de Argentina trabajando.

Don Joaquín y su familia viven en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de playa ancha , que se encuentra como a 2 horas de la ciudad , se dedican la producción de leche cruda , cuyo producto entregan a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de diferentes productos lácteos , actualmente cuentan con 6 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción. También don Joaquín se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sembradios de semillas de cebolla y zanahoria

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, con lo cual incrementara la producción de leche y por lo tanto aumentara su nivel de ingresos y mejorara su nivel de vida. 
Entre sus metas y sueños es aumentar la producción de leche y realizar una mejora a construcción de su casa y en el futuro comprar una casa en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Don Joaquín is 59 years old, married, and has 6 children. His family has limited financial resources. As a result, his three oldest children only completed elementary school and are currently working in Argentina.

Don Joaquín and his family live in the city of Cochabamba, specifically in the community of Playa Ancha, which is located two hours away from the urban areas. He engages in the production of raw milk and delivers his output to a company that develops different types of dairy products. Don Joaquín currently has six dairy cows in production. In addition, he grows onions and carrots.

This loan will be used to purchase one head of dairy cattle, which will increase his milk production as well as his income and living standard. In addition to increasing his milk production, Don Joaquín’s goals are to make improvements to his current home and buy another house in the future that is in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow
